instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCharlemagne, notre grand empereur,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nA passé sept années complètes en Espagne :
output: Set anz tuz pleins ad estet en Espaigne :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJusqu'à la mer, il a conquis la terre haute.
output: Tresqu'en la mer cunquist la tere altaigne.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl n'y a pas de château qui lui résiste ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl ne reste ni mur ni cité à détruire,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSauf Saragosse, qui est sur une montagne.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl sert Mahomet et invoque Apollon :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMais il ne peut éviter que le malheur ne l'atteigne.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl est allé dans un verger à l'ombre.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl appelle ses ducs et ses comtes :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'empereur Charles de douce France

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEst venu dans ce pays pour nous confondre.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl n'y a pas de païen qui réponde un seul mot,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nS'il veut des otages, envoyez-lui-en,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEnvoyons-y les fils de nos épouses :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPour ne pas tuer, j'enverrai le mien.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl vaut mieux qu'ils perdent la tête
output: Asez est melz qu'il i perdent lé chefs

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDit Blancandrin : « Par cette main droite
output: Dist blancandrins : « pa ceste meie destre

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt par la barbe qui me descend jusqu'à la poitrine,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDonnez-moi, sire, le bâton et le gant
output: Dunez m'en, sire, le bastun e le guant

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt j'irai au Sarrasin espagnol,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJe vais voir un peu de son apparence. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'empereur répond avec malveillance :

output: « Alez sedeir desur cel palie blanc !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nN'en parlez plus, si je ne vous le commande ! »
output: N'en parlez mais, se jo nel vos cumant ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Nobles chevaliers, » dit l'empereur Charles,
output: « francs chevalers, » dist li emperere carles,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Choisissez-moi un baron de ma marche,
output: « Car m'eslisez un barun de ma marche,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPour porter mon message à Marsile. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDit Rolland : « Ce sera Guenes, mon beau-père. »
output: Ço dist Rollant : « Ço ert Guenes, mis parastre. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDisent les Français : « Car il peut bien le faire.
output: Dient Franceis : « Car il le poet ben faire.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSi vous le laissez, vous n'enverrez pas plus sage. »
output: Se lui lessez, n'i trametrez plus saive. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt le comte Guenes en fut très contrarié.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl jeta de son cou ses grands manteaux de martre
output: De sun col getet ses grandes pels de martre

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt resta en son bliaut de soie.
output: E est remés en sun blialt de palie.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl avait les yeux vifs et le visage très fier ;
output: Vairs out les oeilz e mult fier lu visage ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl avait le corps noble et les côtés larges ;
output: Gent out le cors e les costez out larges ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl était si beau que tous le regardaient.
output: Tant par fut bels tuit si per l'en esguardent.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl dit à Rolland : « Fou, pourquoi t'emportes-tu ?
output: Dist a Rollant : « Tut fol, pur quei t'esrages ?

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nOn sait bien que je suis ton beau-père,
output: Ço set hom ben que jo sui tis parastres,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt tu as jugé que j'aille à Marsile.
output: Si as juget qu'a Marsiliun en alge.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSi Dieu me permet de revenir de là,
output: Se Deus ço dunet que jo de la repaire,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJe te causerai un si grand malheur
output: Jo t'en muvra un si grant contraire

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQui durera toute ta vie. »
output: Ki durerat a trestut tun edage. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nRépond Rolland : « Orgueil et folie.
output: Respunt Rollant : « Orgoill oi e folage.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nOn sait bien que je n'ai cure de menace.
output: Ço set hom ben n'ai cure de manace.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMais un homme sage doit faire le message :
output: Mai saives hom il deit faire message :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSi le roi veut, je suis prêt à le faire pour vous ! »
output: Si li reis voelt, prez sui por vus le face ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nGuenes répond : « Pour moi, tu n'iras pas !
output: Guenes respunt : « pur mei n'iras tu mie !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTu n'es pas mon homme et je ne suis pas ton seigneur.
output: Tu n'ies mes hom ne jo ne sui tis sire.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCharles a commandé que je fasse son service :
output: Carles comandet que face sun servise :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ Saragosse, j'irai à Marsile.
output: En Sarraguce en irai a Marsilie.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMais j'y ferai un peu de légèreté
output: Einz i frai un poi de legerie

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPour ne pas éclaircir ma grande colère. »
output: Que jo n'esclair ceste meie grant ire. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQuand Rolland l'entendit, il se mit à rire.
output: Quant l'ot Rollant, si cumençat a rire.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQuand Guenes vit que Rolland riait,
output: Quant ço veit guenes qu'ore s'en rit rollant,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl eut un tel chagrin qu'il faillit s'évanouir ;
output: Dunc ad tel doel pur poi d'ire ne fent ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl faillit perdre la raison,
output: A ben petit que il ne pert le sens,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt dit au comte : « Je ne vous aime pas du tout :
output: E dit al cunte : « Jo ne vus aim nient :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nVous avez porté contre moi un faux jugement.
output: Sur mei avez turnet fals jugement.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDroit empereur, me voici présent :
output: Dreiz emperere, veiz me ci en present :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJe veux accomplir votre commandement.
output: Ademplir voeill vostre comandement..

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ Saragosse, je sais bien qu'il me faut aller. Un homme qui y va ne peut revenir.
output: En sarraguce sai ben qu'aler m'estoet. hom ki la vait repairer ne s'en poet.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEn échange, j'ai votre sœur,
output: Ensur que tut si ai jo vostre soer,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJ'ai un fils, jamais plus beau n'exista.
output: Sin ai un filz, ja plus bels n'en estoet.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nC'est Baldewin, » dit-il, « qui sera un homme de valeur.
output: Ço est Baldewin, » ço dit, « ki ert prozdoem.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ lui, je laisse mes honneurs et mes fiefs.
output: A lui lais jo mes honurs e mes fieus.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nGardez-le bien, je ne le verrai plus des yeux. »
output: Guadez le ben, ja nel verrai des oilz. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCharles répond : « Vous avez le cœur tendre.
output: Carles respunt : « Tro avez tendre coer.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPuisque je le commande, il vous faut y aller. »
output: Puis quel comant, aler vus en estoet. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDit le roi : « Guenes, venez ici, recevez le bâton et le gant.
output: Ço dist li reis : « guenes, venez avant, si recevez le bastun e lu guant.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nVous l'avez entendu, les Francs vous jugent.
output: Oït l'avez, sur vos le jugent Franc.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n— Sire, » dit Guenes, « tout cela est l'œuvre de Rolland !
output: — Sire, » dist Guenes, « ço ad tut fait Rollant !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJe ne l'aimerai jamais de ma vie,
output: Ne l'amerai a trestut mun vivant,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nNi Olivier, parce qu'il est son compagnon,
output: Ne Oliver, por ço qu'il est si cumpainz,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nNi les douze pairs, parce qu'ils l'aiment tant.
output: Li duze per, por ço qu'il l'aiment tant.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDéfiez-les, sire, devant vos yeux. »
output: Desfi les en, sire, vostre veiant. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDit le roi : « Vous avez trop mauvais esprit.
output: Ço dist li reis : « Trop avez mal talant.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nVous irez certainement, puisque je le commande.
output: Or irez vos certes, quant jol cumant.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n— Je puis y aller, mais je n'aurai pas de garantie. Il n'en eut pas Basile ni son frère Basant. »
output: — Jo i puis aler, mais n'i avrai guarant. Nu l'out Basilies ne sis freres Basant. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'empereur lui tend son gant droit ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMais le comte Guenes ne voulait pas être là :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQuand il dut le prendre, il lui tomba à terre.

output: Dient Franceis : « Deus, que purrat ço estre ?

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe ce message, il nous arrivera grand malheur.
output: De cest message nos avendrat grant perte.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n— Seigneurs, » dit Guenes, « vous en entendrez des nouvelles ! »
output: — Seignurs, » dist Guenes, « vos en orrez noveles ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQuand je dois partir, je n'ai plus à tarder. »
output: Quant aler dei, n'i ai plus que targer. »

output: Ço dist li reis : « Al Jhesu e al mien ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe sa main droite, il l'a absous et béni,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl se prépare de ses meilleurs vêtements
output: De garnemenz se prent a cunreer,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQu'il peut récupérer :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDes éperons d'or sont attachés à ses pieds,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl a ceint Murglies, son épée, à son côté ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSur Tachebrun, son destrier, il est monté ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'étrier lui tient son oncle Guinemer.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLà, vous verriez tant de chevaliers pleurer,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQui lui disent tous : « Tant de malheur vous est arrivé !
output: Ki tuit li dient : « Tant mare fustes ber !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ la cour du roi, vous avez beaucoup été,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nOn vous appelait noble vassal.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCelui qui a jugé que vous deviez partir
output: Ki ço jugat que doüsez aler

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPar Charlemagne ne sera ni guéri ni apaisé.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe comte Rolland ne devait pas y penser,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCar vous êtes issu d'une très grande parenté. »
output: Que estrait estes de mult grant parented. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEnsuite, ils lui disent : « Sire, emmenez-nous ! »
output: Enprès li dient : « Sire, car nos menez ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nGuenes répond : « Que Dieu ne le veuille !
output: Ço respunt Guenes : « Ne placet Damnedeu !

output: Mielz est que sul moerge que tant bon chevaler.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEn douce France, seigneurs, vous irez :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe ma part, saluez ma femme,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt Pinabel, mon ami et mon pair,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt Baldewin, mon fils que vous connaissez ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAidez-le et tenez-le pour seigneur. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl prend son chemin, il s'est mis en route.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nGuenes chevauche sous un olivier haut,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl s'est joint aux messagers sarrasins,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMais Blancandrin qui s'avance vers lui ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAvec grande sagesse, l'un parle à l'autre.
output: Par grant saveir parolet li uns a l'altre.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nBlancandrin dit : « Charles est un homme merveilleux,
output: Dist Blancandrins : « Merveilus hom est Charles,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQui a conquis Pouille et toute la Calabre !
output: Ki cunquist Puille e trestute Calabre !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nVers l'Angleterre, il a passé la mer salée,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPour le service de saint Pierre, il a conquis le tribut :
output: Ad oes seint Perre en cunquist le chevage :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQue nous veut-il ici, dans notre marche ? »
output: Que nus requert ça en la nostre marche ? »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nGuenes répond : « Tels sont ses desseins.
output: Guenes respunt : « Itels est sis curages.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJamais un homme ne lui résistera. »
output: Jamais n'ert hume ki encuntre lui vaille. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nBlancandrin dit : « Les Francs sont de très nobles hommes
output: Dist blancandrins : « francs sunt mult gentilz home

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMais ils font beaucoup de mal, ce duc et ce comte,
output: Mult grant mal funt e cil duc e cil cunte

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ leur seigneur, qui leur donne de tels conseils :
output: A lur seignur, ki tel cunseill li dunent :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls travaillent et confondent lui et les autres. »
output: Lui e altrui travaillent e cunfundent. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nGuenes répond : « Je ne connais pas d'homme vrai,
output: Guenes respunt : « Jo ne sai veirs nul hume,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSauf Rolland, qui en aura encore honte.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCe matin, l'empereur était sous l'ombre,
output: Er matin sedeit li emperere suz l'umbre,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSon neveu vint, il portait sa broigne,
output: Vint i ses niés, out vestue sa brunie,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl avait pris Carcassonne ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDans sa main, il tenait une pomme vermeille :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTenez, beau sire, dit Rolland à son oncle,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSon orgueil devrait bien le confondre,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCar chaque jour, il s'abandonne à la mort.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSi quelqu'un le tuait, nous aurions la paix. »
output: Seit ki l'ociet, tute pais puis avriumes. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nBlancandrin dit : « Rolland est très mauvais,
output: Dist blancandrins : « mult est pesmes rollant,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl veut faire de tout le monde des lâches
output: Ki tute gent voelt faire recreant

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt mettre toutes les terres en défi !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAvec quelle troupe espère-t-il réussir autant ? »
output: Par quele gent quiet il espleiter tant ? »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nGuenes répond : « Avec les gens de France.
output: Guenes respunt : « Par la franceise gent.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls l'aiment tant qu'ils ne lui manqueront jamais ;
output: Il l'aiment tant ne li faldrunt nient ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl leur donne tant d'or et d'argent,
output: Or e argent lur met tant en present,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDes mulets et des destriers et des tapis et des ornements ;
output: Muls e destrers e palies e guarnemenz ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'empereur lui-même a tout à son gré :
output: L'emperere meïsmes ad tut a sun talent :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl conquérera les terres d'ici jusqu'en Orient. »
output: Cunquerrat li les teres d'ici qu'en Orient. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTant chevauchèrent Guenes et Blancandrin
output: Tant chevalcherent guenes e blancandrins

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQue l'un à l'autre a promis
output: Que l'un a l'altre la sue feit plevit

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQu'ils chercheraient à faire tuer Rolland.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTant chevauchèrent et par chemins et par routes
output: Tant chevalcherent e veies e chemins

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQu'à Saragosse, ils descendent sous un if.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nUn fauteuil était sous l'ombre d'un pin ;
output: Un faldestoet out suz l'umbre d'un pin ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl était enveloppé d'un tapis d'Alexandrie :
output: Envolupet fut d'un palie alexandrin :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLà était le roi qui tenait toute l'Espagne ;
output: La fut li reis ki tute Espaigne tint ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTout autour de lui, vingt mille Sarrasins,
output: Tut entur lui vint milie Sarrazins,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl n'y en a pas un qui dise un mot ni un son,
output: N'i ad celoi ki mot sunt ne mot tint,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPour les nouvelles qu'ils voudraient entendre.
output: Pur les nuveles qu'il vuldreient oïr.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAlors arrivent Guenes et Blancandrin.
output: Atant as vos Guenes e Blanchandrins.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nBlancandrin vient devant Marsile,
output: Blancandrins vint devant marsiliun,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl tient le comte Guenelun par le poing,
output: Par le puign tint le cunte Guenelun,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt dit au roi : « Soyez sauvé par Mahomet
output: E dist al rei : « Salvez seiez de Mahum

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt Apollon, dont nous tenons les saintes lois !
output: E d'Apollin, qui seintes leis tenuns !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nNous avons fait votre message à Charles.
output: Vostre message fesime a Charlun.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl a levé les deux mains vers le ciel,
output: Ambes ses mains en levat cuntremunt,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLoué son Dieu, il n'a fait d'autre réponse.
output: Loat sun Deu, ne fist altre respuns.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl vous envoie un de ses nobles barons
output: Ci vos enveiet un sun noble barun

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQui est de France, et est un homme très riche :
output: Ki est de France, si est mult riches hom :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPar lui, vous entendrez si vous aurez la paix ou non. »
output: Par lui orrez si avrez pais u nun. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMarsile répond : « Maintenant, qu'il parle, nous l'écouterons ! »
output: Respunt Marsilie : « Or diet, nus l'orrum ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMais le comte Guenes s'était bien préparé.
output: Mais li quens guenes se fut ben purpenset.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAvec grande sagesse, il commence à parler
output: Par grant saver cumencet a parler

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nComme celui qui sait bien faire,
output: Cume celui ki ben faire le set,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt dit au roi : « Soyez sauvé par Dieu,
output: E dist al rei : « Salvez seiez de Deu,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe glorieux, que nous devons adorer !
output: Li glorius, qui devum aürer !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCeci vous envoie Charlemagne le brave,
output: Iço vus mandet Carlemagnes li ber,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQue vous receviez la sainte chrétienté ;
output: Que recevez seinte chrestientet ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl veut vous donner la moitié de l'Espagne en fief.
output: Demi Espaigne vos voelt en fiu duner.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSi vous ne voulez pas accorder cet accord,
output: Se cest'acorde ne vulez otrier,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nVous serez pris et lié par la force ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAu siège d'Aix, vous serez amené,
output: Al siege ad Ais en serez amenet,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPar jugement, vous serez là condamné ;
output: Par jugement serez iloec finet ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLà, vous mourrez de honte et de vilenie. »
output: La murrez vus a hunte e a viltet. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe roi Marsile en fut très effrayé.
output: Li reis Marsilies en fut mult esfreed.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl tenait une lance, qui était dorée ;
output: Un algier tint, ki d'or fut enpenet ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl voulait frapper, s'il n'en avait été détourné.
output: Ferir l'en volt, se n'en fust desturnet.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe roi Marsile a changé de couleur,
output: Li reis marsilies ad la culur muee,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe son javelot, il a secoué la hampe.
output: De sun algeir ad la hanste crollee.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQuand Guenes le vit, il mit la main à l'épée,
output: Quant le vit Guenes, mist la main a l'espee,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nContre deux doigts, il l'a tirée du fourreau,
output: Cuntre dous deie l'ad del furrel getee,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt lui a dit : « Vous êtes très beau et clair !
output: Si li ad dit : « Mult estes bele e clere !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJe vous porterai longtemps à la cour du roi !
output: Tant vus avrai en curt a rei portee !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJamais l'empereur de France ne dira
output: Ja nel dirat de France li emperere

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQue je meure seul en terre étrangère,
output: Que suls i moerge en l'estrange cuntree,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMais les meilleurs m'achèteront ! »
output: Einz vos avrunt li meillor cumperee ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDisent les païens : « Calmons la mêlée ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTant le prièrent les meilleurs Sarrasins
output: Tant li preierent li meillor sarrazin

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQue Marsile s'assit dans le fauteuil.
output: Qu'el faldestoed s'es Marsilies asis.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'algalife dit : « Vous nous avez mal conseillé,
output: Dist l'algalifes : « Mal nos avez baillit,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQue vous avez aimé frapper les Français.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nVous devriez écouter et entendre.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n— Sire, » dit Guenes, « il m'est arrivé de souffrir.
output: — Sire, » dist Guenes, « mei l'avent a suffrir.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJe ne laisserais pas, pour tout l'or que Dieu a fait
output: Jo ne lerreie, por tut l'or que Deus fist

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nNi pour tous les biens qui sont en ce pays,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQue je ne lui dise, si j'ai assez de loisir,
output: Que jo ne li die, se tant ai de leisir,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCe que Charles a envoyé, le roi puissant,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPar moi, il a envoyé son ennemi mortel. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl est vêtu d'un manteau de zibeline,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQui est couvert d'un tapis d'Alexandrie :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl le jette à terre, Blancandrin le reçoit :
output: Getet le a tere, sil receit Blancandrin :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMais de son épée, il ne veut pas se séparer ;
output: Mais de s'espee ne volt mie guerpir ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDans son poing droit, il la tient par l'anneau.
output: En sun puign destre par l'orie punt la tint.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDisent les païens : « Noble baron est ici ! »
output: Dient paien : « Noble baron ad ci ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nVers le roi, Guenes s'est approché,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt lui a dit : « Vous vous fâchez à tort,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCar Charles, qui tient la France, vous a envoyé dire

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl vous donnera la moitié de l'Espagne en fief,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'autre moitié aura Rolland, son neveu :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nVous aurez un très orgueilleux partenaire !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSi vous ne voulez pas accorder cet accord,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ Saragosse, il viendra vous assiéger.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPar la force, vous serez pris et lié ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nVous serez amené droit à Aix le siège.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nVous n'aurez ni palefroi ni destrier,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nNi mulet ni mule que vous puissiez chevaucher ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nVous serez jeté sur un mauvais somier.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPar jugement, là, vous perdrez la tête.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nNotre empereur vous envoie cette lettre. »
output: Nostre emperere vus enveiet cest bref. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDans le poing droit du païen, il l'a livrée.
output: El destre poign al paien l'ad livret.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMarsile fut enragé de colère,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl brisa le sceau, jeta la cire,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl regarda la lettre, vit la raison écrite :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Charles m'a envoyé, qui a la France en charge,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQue je me souvienne de la douleur et de la colère,
output: Que me remembre de la dolur e de l'ire,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nC'est de Basan et de son frère Basilie
output: Ço est de Basan e de sun frere Basilie

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDont il a pris les têtes dans les montagnes de Haltoïe ;
output: Dunt pris les chefs as puis de Haltoïe ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSi je veux sauver ma vie,
output: Se de mun cors voeil aquiter la vie,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJe lui enverrai mon oncle l'algalife ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAutrement, il ne m'aimera pas. »
output: Altrement ne m'amerat il mie. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAprès, son fils parla à Marsile
output: Après parlat ses filz envers Marsilies

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt dit au roi : « Guenes a dit des folies.
output: E dist al rei : « Guenes ad dit folie.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl a tellement erré qu'il n'est pas juste qu'il vive plus longtemps.
output: Tant ad erret nen est dreiz que plus vivet.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLivrez-le-moi, je ferai justice de lui. »
output: Livrez le mei, jo en ferai la justise. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQuand Guenes l'entendit, il brandit son épée ;
output: Quant l'oït Guenes, l'espee en ad branlie ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl va s'appuyer sous le pin à la tige.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDans le verger, le roi est allé,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl emmène ses meilleurs hommes avec lui,
output: Ses meillors humes en meinet ensembl'od sei,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt Blancandrin y vient, aux cheveux blancs,
output: E Blancandrins i vint, al canud peil,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt Jurfaret, qui est son fils et son héritier,
output: E Jurfaret, ki est ses filz e ses heirs,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt l'algalife, son oncle et son fidèle.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nBlancandrin dit : « Appelez le Français :
output: Dist Blancandrins : « Apelez le Franceis :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe notre prudence, il m'a promis sa foi. »
output: De nostre prod m'ad plevie sa feid. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe roi dit : « Et vous l'amenez ici. »
output: Ço dist li reis : « E vos l'i ameneiz. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nGuenelun le prend par la main droite,
output: Guenelun prist par la main destre ad deiz,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDans le verger, il l'emmène jusqu'au roi.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLà, ils préparent la trahison en secret.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Beau sire Guenes, » lui dit Marsile,
output: « bel sire guenes, » ço li ad dit marsilie,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Je vous ai fait quelque légèreté,
output: « Jo vos ai fait alques de legerie,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQuand pour frapper, je vous ai montré grande colère.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJe vous donne en don ces peaux de zibeline,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nElles valent mieux que cinq cents livres d'or :
output: Melz en valt l'or que ne funt cinc cenz livres :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAvant demain soir, il y aura belle amende. »
output: Einz demain noit en iert bele l'amendise. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nGuenes répond : « Je ne le nierai pas.
output: Guenes respunt : « Jo nel desotrei mie.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDieu, s'il lui plaît, vous en remercie bien ! »
output: Deus, se lui plaist, a bien le vos mercie » !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMarsile dit : « Guenes, sachez-le bien,
output: Ço dist marsilies : « guenes, par veir sacez,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJ'ai envie de vous aimer beaucoup.
output: En talant ai que mult vos voeill amer.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe Charlemagne, je veux vous entendre parler.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl est très vieux, il a usé son temps ;
output: Il est mult vielz, si ad sun tens uset ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ mon avis, il a passé deux cents ans.
output: Men escient dous cenz anz ad passet.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPar tant de terres, il a mené son corps,
output: Par tantes teres ad sun cors demened,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes félons païens sont mal rassemblés :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJe vous promets, ils sont livrés à la mort. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Compagnon Rolland, sonnez votre olifant,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n— Que Dieu ne le veuille, » répond Rolland,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nNi pour un païen, que je sonne jamais le cor !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJamais mes parents n'en auront reproche.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQuand je serai dans la grande bataille
output: Quant jo serai en la bataille grant

output: Ja cil d'Espaigne n'avrunt de mort guarant. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes armées de cette gent étrangère sont grandes ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nNous avons ici une très petite compagnie. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nRolland répond : « Mon désir est plus grand.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQue Dieu et ses anges ne le veuillent
output: Ne placet Damnedeu ne ses angles

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQue pour moi, la France perde sa valeur !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJe préfère mourir que la honte me vienne.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPour bien frapper, l'empereur nous aime plus. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nRolland est brave et Olivier est sage.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTous deux ont un merveilleux courage :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPuisqu'ils sont à cheval et en armes,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJamais pour mourir, ils n'éviteront la bataille.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nOlivier dit : « Rolland, voyez quelque chose :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls sont près de nous, mais Charles est trop loin.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nVous n'avez pas daigné sonner votre olifant ;
output: Vostre olifan suner, vos nel deignastes ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nS'il était là, nous n'aurions pas de dommage.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nRegardez en haut vers les ports d'Espagne,

output: Veeir poez, dolente est la rereguarde ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCelui qui fait cela, jamais il n'en fera d'autre. »
output: Ki ceste fait, ja mais n'en ferat altre. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nRolland répond : « Ne dites pas de telles outrages !
output: Respunt Rollant : « Ne dites tel ultrage !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMalheur à celui dont le cœur se fait lâche !
output: Mal seit del coer ki el piz se cuardet !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nNous resterons en place sur le champ ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPar nous, il y aura les coups et les combats. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQuand Rolland voit que la bataille sera,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl se fait plus fier qu'un lion ou un léopard.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl crie aux Français, il appelle Olivier :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Sire compagnon, ami, ne le dites jamais !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'empereur, qui nous a laissés Français,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nA mis tels vingt mille d'un côté
output: Itels .XX. milie en mist a une part

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ son avis, il n'y a pas un lâche.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPour son seigneur, un homme doit souffrir de grands maux
output: Pur sun seignur deit hom susfrir granz mals

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt endurer de grands froids et de grandes chaleurs,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl doit perdre du sang et de la chair.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nFrappe de ta lance et moi de Durendal,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl éperonne son cheval et monte sur une colline ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl appelle les Français, il leur dit un sermon :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Seigneurs barons, Charles nous a laissés ici ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPour notre roi, nous devons bien mourir.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAidez à soutenir la chrétienté !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nVous aurez bataille, vous en êtes tous sûrs,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCar à vos yeux, vous voyez les Sarrasins.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nConfessez vos fautes, et priez Dieu de vous pardonner ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt l'archevêque de Dieu les bénit :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes Français se redressent, ils se mettent debout.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls sont bien absous et quittes de leurs péchés,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt l'archevêque de Dieu les a bénis,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPuis ils sont montés sur leurs destriers rapides.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls sont équipés selon la loi des chevaliers

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe comte Rolland appelle Olivier :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Sire compagnon, vous savez très bien
output: « Sire cumpainz, mult ben le saviez

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl a pris de l'or et des biens et de l'argent.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe roi Marsile a fait marché de nous ;

output: As porz d'espaigne en est passet rollant

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSur Veillantif, son bon cheval rapide.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl porte ses armes, elles lui vont bien,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMais sa lance va le brave en brandissant,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nVers le ciel, il tourne la pointe,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes rangs lui battent jusqu'aux mains.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nVers les Sarrasins, il regarde fièrement

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt vers les Français, humblement et doucement,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJamais roi de France n'en eut de si vaillant. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nOlivier dit : « Je n'ai pas envie de parler.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nVous n'avez pas daigné sonner votre olifant,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nNi de Charles, vous n'avez rien dit.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl n'en sait rien, le brave n'a pas de faute.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCeux qui sont là ne font pas à blâmer.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nChevauchez à tout ce que vous pouvez !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSeigneurs barons, dans le champ, restez !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPour Dieu, je vous prie, soyez bien préparés
output: Pur Deu vos pri, ben seiez purpensez

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ frapper des coups, à recevoir et à donner !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nNous ne devons pas oublier l'étendard de Charles. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ ce mot, les Français s'écrient.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQui alors entendrait demander Montjoie,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl pourrait se souvenir de vaillance.

output: Puis si chevalchent, Deus ! par si grant fiertet !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls éperonnent pour aller le plus vite possible,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt ils vont frapper, que feraient-ils d'autre ?

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe neveu de Marsile, il s'appelle Aelroth ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl va disant de si mauvais mots de nos Français :

output: Enquoi perdrat France dulce sun los,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCharles le grand, le bras droit du corps. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl éperonne son cheval, le laisse courir à toute force,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl lui sépare toute l'échine du dos,
