instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAvec sa lance, il lui jette l'âme dehors,
output: Od sun espiet l'anme li getet fors,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl le pousse bien, il fait brandir le corps,
output: Enpeint le ben, fait li brandir le cors,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl abat la lance pleine du cheval mort,
output: Pleine sa hanste del cheval l'abat mort,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEn deux morceaux, il lui brise le cou.
output: En dous meitiez li ad briset le col.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl ne le laissera pas, dit-il, sans parler :
output: Ne leserat, ço dit, que n'i parolt :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Va-t'en, lâche ! Charles n'est pas fou,
output: « Ultre, culvert ! Carles n'est mie fol,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl n'a jamais voulu aimer la trahison.
output: Ne traïsun unkes amer ne volt.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl a bien fait de nous laisser aux ports.
output: Il fist que proz qu'il nus laisad as porz.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAujourd'hui, douce France ne perdra pas sa renommée.
output: Oi n'en perdrat France dulce sun los.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nFrappez-y, Français, notre coup est le premier !
output: Ferez i, Francs, nostre est li premers colps !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nNous avons raison, mais ces gloutons ont tort. »
output: Nos avum dreit, mais cist glutun unt tort. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl y a un duc, il s'appelle Falsaron ;
output: Un duc i est, si ad num falsaron ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCelui-ci était frère du roi Marsile.
output: Icil er frere al rei Marsiliun.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl tenait la terre de Dathan et Abiron.
output: Il tint la tere Dathan e Abirun.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSous le ciel, il n'y a pas de plus félon.
output: Suz cel nen at plus encrisme felun.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEntre les deux yeux, il a un front très large,
output: Entre les dous oilz mult out large le front,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nUn grand demi-pied peut y être mesuré.
output: Grant demi pied mesurer i pout hom.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl a beaucoup de deuil quand il voit son neveu mort,
output: Asez ad doel quant vit mort sun nevold,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl sort de la presse, il se met en avant,
output: Ist de la prese, si se met en bandun,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt il crie l'étendard païen.
output: E si escriet l'enseigne paienor.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEnvers les Français, il est très contraire :
output: Envers Franceis est mult cuntrarius :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Aujourd'hui, douce France perdra son honneur ! »
output: « Enquoi perdrat France dulce s'onur ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nOlivier l'entend, il en a une très grande colère.
output: Ot le Oliver, sin ad mult grant irur.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl éperonne son cheval avec les éperons dorés,
output: Le cheval brochet des oriez esperuns,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl va le frapper en guise de baron.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl brise son écu et déchire son haubert,
output: L'escut li freint e l'osberc li derumpt,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl lui met les pans de l'étendard dans le corps,
output: El cors li met les pans del gunfanun,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl abat la lance pleine des arçons ;
output: Pleine sa hanste l'abat mort des arçuns ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl regarde à terre, il voit le glouton gisant,
output: Guardet a tere, veit gesir le glutun,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt il lui dit avec une raison très fière :
output: Si li ad dit par mult fiere raison :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« De vos menaces, lâche, je n'ai pas peur.
output: « De voz manaces, culvert, jo n'ai essoign.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nFrappez-y, Français, car nous les vaincrons très bien ! »
output: Ferez i, Francs, kar trés ben les veintrum ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMontjoie crie, c'est l'étendard de Charles.
output: Munjoie escriet, ço est l'enseigne Carlun.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl y a un roi, il s'appelle Corsablix,
output: Uns reis i est, si ad num corsablix,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl est barbare, d'un pays étranger,
output: Barbarins est, d'un estrage païs,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl appelle les autres Sarrasins :
output: Si apelad les altres Sarrazins :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Cette bataille, nous pouvons bien la tenir,
output: « Ceste bataille ben la puum tenir,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCar il y a très peu de Français.
output: Kar de Franceis i ad asez petit.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCeux qui sont ici, nous devons les mépriser.
output: Cels ki ci sunt devum aveir mult vil.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJamais pour Charles, il n'y aura un seul sauvé :
output: Ja pur Charles n'i ert un sul guarit :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAujourd'hui est le jour où ils devront mourir. »
output: Or est le jur qu'els estuvrat murir. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'archevêque Turpin l'entend bien,
output: Ben l'entendit li arcevesques Turpin,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSous le ciel, il n'y a pas d'homme qu'il veuille haïr autant.
output: Suz ciel n'at hume que tant voeillet haïr.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl éperonne son cheval avec les éperons d'or fin,
output: Sun cheval brochet des esperuns d'or fin,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAvec grande vertu, il va le frapper.
output: Par grant vertut si l'est alet ferir.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl brise son écu, il déchire son haubert,
output: L'escut li freinst, l'osberc li descumfist,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl lui met sa grande lance dans le corps,
output: Sun grant espiet par mi le cors li mist,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl le pousse bien, il le fait brandir mort,
output: Empeint le ben, que mort le fait brandir,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl abat la lance pleine sur le chemin.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl regarde à terre, il voit le glouton gisant,
output: Guardet a tere, veit le glutun gesir,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl ne le laissera pas sans parler, dit-il :
output: Ne laisserat que n'i parolt, ço dit :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Lâche païen, vous avez menti !
output: « Culvert paien, vos i avez mentit !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCharles, mon seigneur, nous est garant tous les jours.
output: Carles, mi sire, nus est guarant tuz dis.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nNos Français n'ont pas l'intention de fuir.
output: Nostre Franceis n'unt talent de fuïr.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nVos compagnons seront tous restés.
output: Voz cumpaignuns feruns trestuz restifs.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJe vous dis des nouvelles, vous devrez subir la mort.
output: Nuveles vos di, mort vos estoet susfrir.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nFrappez, Français ! Aucun de vous ne s'oublie !
output: Ferez, Franceis ! Nul de vus ne s'ublit !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCe premier coup est le nôtre, Dieu merci ! »
output: Cist premer colp est nostre, Deu mercit ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMontjoie crie pour retenir le champ.
output: Munjoie escriet por le camp retenir.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt Gerin frappe Malprimis de Brigant.
output: E gerins fiert malprimis de brigal.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSon bon écu ne vaut pas un denier :
output: Sis bons escuz un dener ne li valt :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl brise toute la boucle de cristal,
output: Tute li freint la bucle de cristal,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl tourne une moitié à l'envers ;
output: L'une meitiet li turnet cuntreval ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl lui rompt le haubert jusqu'à la chair,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl lui enfonce sa bonne lance dans le corps ;
output: Sun bon espiet enz el cors li enbat ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe païen tombe à l'envers dans un fossé.
output: Li paiens chet cuntreval a un quat.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSatan emporte son âme.
output: L'anme de lui en portet Sathanas.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt son compagnon Gerers frappe l'amiral.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl brise son écu et démaillote son haubert,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl lui met sa bonne lance dans la poitrine,
output: Sun bon espiet li met en la curaille,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl le pousse bien, il le traverse de part en part,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl l'abat mort dans le champ, la lance pleine.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nOlivier dit : « Notre bataille est belle ! »
output: Dist Oliver : « Gente est nostre bataille ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSanson le duc, il va frapper l'almaçur.
output: Sansun li dux, il vait ferir l'almaçur.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl brise son écu, qui est doré et fleuri,
output: L'escut li freinst, ki est ad or e a flurs,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe bon haubert ne lui est pas de grand secours,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl lui tranche le cœur, le foie et le poumon,
output: Trenchet li le coer, le firie e le pulmun,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl l'abat mort, qu'on le veuille ou non.
output: Que l'abat mort, qui qu'en peist u qui nun.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'archevêque dit : « Ce coup est de baron ! »
output: Dist l'arcevesque : « Cist colp est de baron ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt Anseïs laisse courir son cheval,
output: E anseïs laiset le cheval curre,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl va frapper Turgis de Turteluse.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl brise son écu sous la boucle dorée,
output: L'escut li freint desuz l'oree bucle,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl lui déchire les doubles de son haubert,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl lui met la pointe de sa bonne lance dans le corps,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl le pousse bien, il lui enfonce tout le fer,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl l'abat mort dans le champ, la lance pleine.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nRolland dit : « Ce coup est de brave homme ! »
output: Ço dist Rollant : « Cist colp est de produme ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt Engelers le Gascon de Bordeaux
output: Et engelers li guascuinz de burdele

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÉperonne son cheval, il lui lâche la bride,
output: Sun cheval brochet, si li laschet la resne,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl va frapper Escremiz de Valterne.

output: L'escut del col li freint e escantelet,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl le frappe au cœur entre les deux fourches,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl l'abat mort de la selle, la lance pleine.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAprès, il dit : « Vous êtes retourné à la perte ! »
output: Après li dist : « Turnet estes a perdre ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt Otes frappe un païen, Estorgans,
output: E otes fiet un paien, estorgans,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSur son écu, dans la partie avant,
output: Sur sun escut en la pene devant,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl lui tranche tout le vermeil et le blanc ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl lui a rompu les pans de son haubert,
output: De sun osberc li ad rumput les pans,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl lui met sa bonne lance tranchante dans le corps,
output: El cors li met sun bon espiet trechant,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl l'abat mort de son cheval courant.
output: Que mort l'abat de sun cheval curant.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAprès, il dit : « Vous n'aurez pas de garantie ! »
output: Après li dist : « Ja n'i avrez guarant ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt Berenger, il frappe Astramariz.
output: E berenger, il fiert astramariz.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl brise son écu, il démaillote son haubert,
output: L'escut li freinst, l'osberc li descumfist,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl lui met son fort écu dans le corps,
output: Sun fort escut par mi le cors li mist,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl l'abat mort parmi mille Sarrasins.
output: Que mort l'abat entre mil Sarrazins.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDes douze pairs, dix sont tués ;
output: Des .XII. pers li .X. en sunt ocis ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl n'en reste que deux vivants :
output: Ne mès que dous n'en i ad remés vifs :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nC'est Chernubles et le comte Margariz.
output: Ço est Chernubles e li quens Margariz.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMargariz est un très vaillant chevalier,
output: Margariz est mult vaillant chevalers,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt beau et fort et agile et léger.
output: E bels e forz e isnels e legers.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl éperonne son cheval, il va frapper Olivier.
output: Le cheval brochet, vait ferir Oliver.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl lui brise l'écu sous la boucle d'or pur,
output: L'escut li freint suz la bucle d'or mer,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl lui conduit sa lance près du côté.
output: Lez le costet li conduist sun espiet.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDieu le sauve, qu'il ne l'a pas touché au corps.
output: Deus le guarit, qu'el cors ne l'ad tuchet.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLa lance se brise, il ne l'abat pas.
output: La hanste fruisset, mie n'en abatiet.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl s'en va plus loin, il n'y a pas d'obstacle ;
output: Ultre s'en vait, qu'il n'i ad desturber ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl sonne sa trompette pour rallier les siens.
output: Sunet sun gresle pur les soens ralier.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLa bataille est merveilleuse et commune.
output: La bataille est merveilleuse e cumune.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe comte Rolland ne se fatigue pas,
output: Li quens Rollant mie ne s'asoüret,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl frappe de la lance tant que la hampe dure ;
output: Fiert de l'espiet tant cume hanste li duret ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ quinze coups, il l'a brisée et perdue ;
output: A .XV. cols l'ad fraite e perdue ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl tire Durendal, sa bonne épée, nue,
output: Trait Durendal, sa bone espee, nue,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl éperonne son cheval, il va frapper Chernubles.
output: Sun cheval brochet, si vait ferir Chernuble.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl lui brise le casque où les pierres précieuses brillent.
output: L'elme li freint u li carbuncle luisent.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl tranche le corps et la chevelure,
output: Trenchet le cors e la cheveleüre,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl lui tranche les yeux et le visage,
output: Si li trenchat les oilz e la faiture,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe blanc haubert, dont la maille est fine,
output: Le blanc osberc, dunt la maile est menue,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt tout le corps jusqu'à la fourche.
output: E tut le cors tresqu'en la furcheüre.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDans la selle, qui est dorée,
output: Enz en la sele, ki est a or batue,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDans le cheval, l'épée est arrêtée ;

output: Danz oliver trait ad sa bone espee

output: Mais nepurquant si est il asez melz :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQue le roi vienne, il pourra nous venger ;
output: Venget li reis, si nus purrat venger ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDéjà ceux d'Espagne ne doivent pas s'en retourner joyeux.
output: Ja cil d'Espaigne ne s'en deivent turner liez.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nNos Français descendront à pied,
output: Nostre Franceis i descendrunt a pied,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls nous trouveront morts et déchiquetés,
output: Truverunt nos e morz e detrenchez,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls nous soulèveront sur des bières sur des mulets,
output: Leverunt nos en bieres sur sumers,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls nous pleureront de douleur et de pitié,
output: Si nus plurrunt de doel e de pitet,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls nous enterreront dans les cloîtres des monastères ;
output: Enfuerunt nos en aitres de musters ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nNi loup ni porc ni chien ne nous mangeront. »
output: N'en mangerunt ne lu ne porc ne chen. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nRoland répond : « Sire, vous parlez très bien. »
output: Respunt Rollant : « Sire, mult dites bien. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nRoland a mis l'olifant à sa bouche,
output: Rollant ad mis l'olifan a sa buche,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl le pousse bien, par grande vertu il le sonne.
output: Empeint le ben, par grant vertut le sunet.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes montagnes sont hautes et la voix est très longue,
output: Halt sunt li pui e la voiz est mult lunge,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ trente lieues, ils l'entendirent répondre.
output: Granz .XXX. liwes l'oïrent il respundre.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCharles l'entendit et tous ses compagnons.
output: Karles l'oït e ses cumpaignes tutes.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe roi dit : « Nos hommes font bataille ! »
output: Ço dit li reis : « Bataille funt nostre hume ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt Ganelon lui répondit en face :
output: E Guenelun li respundit encuntre :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Si un autre le disait, cela semblerait un grand mensonge ! »
output: « S'altre le desist, ja semblast grant mençunge ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe comte Roland, par peine et par effort,
output: Li quens rollant, par peine e par ahans,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPar grande douleur, sonne son olifant.
output: Par grant dulor sunet sun olifan.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPar sa bouche, le sang clair jaillit.
output: Par mi la buche en salt fors li cler sancs.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe son cerveau, la tempe est rompue.
output: De sun cervel le temple en est rumpant.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDu cor qu'il tient, l'ouïe en est très grande :
output: Del corn qu'il tient l'oïe en est mult grant :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCharles l'entend, qui passe aux ports.
output: Karles l'entent, ki est as porz passant.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe duc Naimes l'entendit, et les Français l'écoutent.
output: Naimes li duc l'oïd, si l'escultent li Franc.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe roi dit : « J'entends le cor de Roland !
output: Ce dist li reis : « Jo oi le corn Rollant !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJamais il ne le sonnerait, s'il n'était en combat. »
output: Unc nel sunast, se ne fust cumbatant. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nGanelon répond : « De bataille, il n'y a rien !
output: Guenes respunt : « De bataille est nient !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nVous êtes vieux et florissant et blanc ;
output: Ja estes veilz e fluriz e blancs ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPar de telles paroles, vous ressemblez à un enfant.
output: Par tels paroles vus resemblez enfant.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nVous connaissez bien le grand orgueil de Roland ;
output: Asez savez le grant orgoill Rollant ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nC'est une merveille que Dieu le supporte tant.
output: Ço est merveille que Deus le soefret tant.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDevant ses pairs, il va maintenant se vanter.
output: Devant ses pers vait il ore gabant.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSous le ciel, il n'y a pas de gens qui oseraient le chercher en champ.
output: Suz cel n'ad gent ki l'osast querre en champ.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPourquoi chevauchez-vous ? Pourquoi vous arrêtez-vous ?
output: Car chevalcez ! Pur qu'alez arestant ?

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLa Terre Majeure est très loin devant. »
output: Tere Major mult est loinz ça devant. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe comte Roland a la bouche sanglante.
output: Li quens rollant ad la buche sanglente.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe son cerveau, la tempe est rompue.
output: De sun cervel rumput en est li temples.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl sonne l'olifant avec douleur et peine.
output: L'olifan sunet a dulor e a peine.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCharles l'entend et ses Français l'entendent.
output: Karles l'oït e ses Franceis l'entendent.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe roi dit : « Ce cor a une longue haleine ! »
output: Ço dist li reis : « Cel corn ad lunge aleine ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe duc Naimes répond : « Baron, il fait la peine !
output: Respont dux Neimes : « Baron i fait la peine !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl y a bataille, par mon jugement.
output: Bataille i ad, par le men escientre.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCelui qui vous en a fait feindre est un traître.
output: Cil l'at traït ki vos en roevet feindre.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nArmez-vous, et criez votre enseigne,
output: Adubez vos, si criez vostre enseigne,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt secourez votre maisonnée noble :
output: Si sucurez vostre maisnee gente :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nVous entendez bien que Roland se lamente ! »
output: Asez oez que Rollant se dementet ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'empereur a fait sonner ses cors.
output: Li empereres ad fait suner ses corns.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes Français descendent, ils arment leurs corps
output: Franceis descendent, si adubent lor cors

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe cottes de mailles et de casques et d'épées d'or.
output: D'osbercs e de helmes e d'espees a or.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls ont de beaux boucliers et de grandes et fortes lances,
output: Escuz unt genz e espiez granz e forz,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt des bannières blanches et vermeilles et bleues.
output: E gunfanuns blancs e vermeilz e blois.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTous les barons de l'armée montent sur leurs destriers,
output: Es destrers muntent tuit li barun de l'ost,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls poussent jusqu'à ce que les ports soient franchis.
output: Brochent ad ait tant cum durent li port.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl n'y a personne qui parle à l'autre :
output: N'i ad celoi a l'altre ne parolt :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Si nous voyions Roland avant qu'il ne soit mort,
output: « Se veïssum Rollant einz qu'il fust mort,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEnsemble avec lui, nous donnerions de grands coups. »
output: Ensembl'od lui i durriums granz colps. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ quoi bon ? Car ils ont trop tardé.
output: De ço qui calt ? car demuret i unt trop.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe soir et le jour sont éclaircis.
output: Esclargiz est li vespres e li jurz.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nContre le soleil, brillent ces armures,
output: Cuntre le soleil reluisent cil adub,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes cottes de mailles et les casques jettent un grand éclat,
output: Osbercs e helmes i getent grant flabur,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt ces boucliers, qui sont bien peints de fleurs,
output: E cil escuz, ki ben sunt peinz a flurs,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt ces lances, ces bannières dorées.
output: E cil espiez, cil oret gunfanun.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'empereur chevauche avec colère
output: Li empereres cevalchet par irur

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt les Français sont tristes et courroucés ;
output: E li Franceis dolenz e curoçus ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl n'y a personne qui ne pleure durement,
output: N'i ad celoi ki durement ne plurt,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt ils sont en grande peur pour Roland.
output: E de Rollant sunt en grant poür.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe roi fait prendre le comte Ganelon,
output: Li reis fait prendre le cunte Guenelun,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl le confie aux gardes de sa maison.
output: Sil cumandat as cous de sa maisun.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl appelle tous les plus grands, Besgun :
output: Tut li plus maistre en apelet, Besgun :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Gardez-le bien pour moi, comme tel félon !
output: « Ben le me guarde, si cume tel felon !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe ma maisonnée, il a fait trahison. »
output: De ma maisnee ad faite traïsun. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCelui-ci le reçoit, et met cent compagnons
output: Cil le receit, s'i met .C. cumpaignons

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe la cuisine des meilleurs et des pires.
output: De la quisine des mielz e des peiurs.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls lui arrachent la barbe et les moustaches,
output: Icil li peilent la barbe e les gernuns,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nChacun lui donne quatre coups de poing,
output: Cascun le fiert .IIII. colps de son puign,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls le battent bien avec des bâtons et des gourdins
output: Ben le batirent a fuz e a bastuns

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt lui mettent au cou un collier,
output: E si li metent el col un caeignun,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls l'enchaînent comme un ours ;
output: Si l'encaeinent altresi cum un urs ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSur un mulet, ils l'ont mis en déshonneur.
output: Sur un sumer l'unt mis a deshonor.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls le gardent jusqu'à ce qu'ils le rendent à Charles.
output: Tant le guardent quel rendent a Charlun.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes montagnes sont hautes et ténébreuses et grandes, les vallées profondes et les eaux courantes.
output: Halt sunt li pui e tenebrus e grant, li val parfunt e les ewes curant.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes trompettes sonnent derrière et devant
output: Sunent cil graisle e derere e devant

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt tous répondent contre l'olifant.
output: E tuit rachatent encuntre l'olifant.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'empereur chevauche avec colère
output: Li empereres chevalchet ireement

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt les Français sont courroucés et tristes ;
output: E li Franceis curuçus e dolent ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl n'y a personne qui ne pleure et ne se lamente,
output: N'i ad celoi n'i plurt e se dement,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt ils prient Dieu qu'il sauve Roland
output: E prient Deu qu'il guarisset Rollant

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJusqu'à ce qu'ils viennent au champ communément :
output: Josque il vengent el camp cumunement :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEnsemble avec lui, ils frapperont vraiment.
output: Ensembl'od lui i ferrunt veirement.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ quoi bon ? Car cela ne leur sert à rien.
output: De ço qui calt ? car ne lur valt nient.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls ont trop tardé, ils ne peuvent être à temps.
output: Demurent trop, n'i poedent estre a tens.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAvec grande colère, le roi Charles chevauche ;
output: Par grant irur chevalchet li reis charles ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSur sa cotte de mailles repose sa barbe blanche.
output: Desur sa brunie li gist sa blanche barbe.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTous les barons de France poussent ;
output: Puignent ad ait tuit li barun de France ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl n'y a personne qui ne montre de colère
output: N'i ad icel ne demeint irance

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQu'ils ne soient à Roland le capitaine,
output: Que il ne sunt a Rollant le cataigne,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQui combat les Sarrasins d'Espagne,
output: Ki se cumbat as Sarrazins d'Espaigne,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl est blessé, il ne pense pas qu'il lui reste une âme.
output: Si est blecet, ne quit qu'anme i remaigne.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDieu ! Quels soixante hommes il a dans sa compagnie !
output: Deus ! quels seisante humes i ad en sa cumpaigne !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJamais meilleurs n'en eut roi ni capitaine.
output: Unches meillurs n'en out reis ne cataignes.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nRoland regarde les montagnes et les vallées ;
output: Rollant reguardet es munz e es lariz ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl voit tant de morts de ceux de France,
output: De cels de France i veit tanz morz gesir,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt il les pleure comme un chevalier noble :
output: E il les pluret cum chevaler gentill :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Seigneurs barons, que Dieu ait pitié de vous !
output: « Seignors barons, de vos ait Deus mercit !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQu'il accorde à toutes vos âmes le paradis !
output: Tutes voz anmes otreit il pareïs !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQu'il les fasse reposer parmi les saintes fleurs !
output: En seintes flurs il les facet gesir !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJe n'ai jamais vu de meilleurs vassaux que vous.
output: Meillors vassals de vos unkes ne vi.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSi longtemps vous m'avez servi,
output: Si lungement tuz tens m'avez servit,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPour Charles, vous avez conquis tant de pays !
output: A oes Carlon si granz païs cunquis !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'empereur vous a tant nourris !
output: Li empereres tant mare vos nurrit !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTerre de France, tu es un pays doux,
output: Tere de France, mult estes dulz païs,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAujourd'hui déserté [à tant de robustes exils].
output: Oi desertet [a tant rubostl exill].

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nBarons français, pour moi je vous vois mourir :
output: Barons franceis, pur mei vos vei murir :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJe ne peux vous retenir ni vous garantir ;
output: Jo ne vos pois tenser ne guarantir ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQue Dieu vous aide, qui jamais ne mentit !
output: Aït vos Deus, ki unkes ne mentit !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nOlivier frère, je ne dois pas vous faillir.
output: Oliver frere, vos ne dei jo faillir.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe douleur je mourrai, si un autre ne m'y tue.
output: De doel murra, s'altre ne m'i ocit.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSire compagnon, allons-y frapper ! »
output: Sire cumpainz, alum i referir ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe comte Roland est retourné au champ.
output: Li quens rollant el champ est repairet.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl tient Durandal, comme un vassal il frappe.
output: Tient Durendal, cume vassal i fiert.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nFaldrun de Puy, il l'a tranché en deux,
output: Faldrun de Pui i ad par mi trenchet,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt vingt-quatre des meilleurs estimés :
output: E .XXIIII. de tuz les melz preisez :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJamais homme ne sera plus s'il veut se venger.
output: Jamais n'iert home plus se voeillet venger.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nComme le cerf s'en va devant les chiens,
output: Si cum li cerfs s'en vait devant les chiens,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDevant Roland, les païens fuient.
output: Devant Rollant si s'en fuient paiens.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'archevêque dit : « Vous le faites bien !
output: Dist l'arcevesque : « Asez le faites ben !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nUn chevalier doit avoir telle valeur
output: Itel valor deit aveir chevaler

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQui porte des armes et monte un bon cheval :
output: Ki armes portet e en bon cheval set :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEn bataille, il doit être fort et fier,
output: En bataille deit estre forz e fiers,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSinon, il ne vaut pas quatre deniers,
output: U altrement ne valt .IIII. deners,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl doit plutôt être moine dans un de ces monastères,
output: Einz deit monie estre en un de cez mustiers,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt prier tous les jours pour nos péchés. »
output: Si prierat tuz jurz por noz peccez. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nRoland répond : « Frappez, ne vous épargnez pas ! »
output: Respunt Rollant : « Ferez, nes esparignez ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ ces mots, les Français recommencent.
output: A icest mot l'unt Francs recumencet.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl y a un grand dommage de chrétiens.
output: Mult grant damage i out de chrestiens.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nUn homme qui sait qu'il n'aura jamais de prison
output: Home ki ço set que ja n'avrat prisun

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDans telle bataille fait grande défense :
output: En tel bataill fait grant defension :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nC'est pourquoi les Français sont aussi fiers que des lions.
output: Pur ço sunt Francs si fiers cume leuns.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ vous, Marsile, en guise de baron.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl est sur le cheval qu'il appelle Gaignun,
output: Siet el cheval qu'il apelet Gaignun,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl le pousse bien, et va frapper Bevon :
output: Brochet le ben, si vait ferir Bevon :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCelui-ci était seigneur de Belne et de Dijon.
output: Icil ert sire de Belne e de Digun.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl lui brise le bouclier et lui rompt la cotte de mailles,
output: L'escut li freint e l'osberc li derumpt,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl le tue sans autre défaite,
output: Que mort l'abat seinz altre descunfisun,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPuis il a tué Yvoeries et Ivon,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAvec eux Gérard de Roussillon.
output: Ensembl'od els Gerard de Russillun.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe comte Roland n'est pas loin ;
output: Li quens Rollant ne li est guaires loign ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl dit au païen : « Que Dieu te maudisse !
output: Dist al paien : « Damnesdeus mal te duinst !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ si grand tort, tu as tué mes compagnons !
output: A si grant tort m'ociz mes cumpaignuns !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nUn coup tu auras avant que nous nous séparions.
output: Colp en avras einz que nos departum.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt de mon épée, tu sauras encore le nom. »
output: E de m'espee enquoi savras le nom. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl va le frapper en guise de baron.
output: Vait le ferir en guise de baron.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe comte lui a tranché la main droite,
output: Trenchet li ad li quens le destre poign,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPuis il prend la tête de Jurfaleu le blond ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCelui-ci était le fils du roi Marsile.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes païens crient : « Aidez-nous, Mahomet !
output: Paien escrient : « Aïe nos, Mahum !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nNos dieux, vengez-nous de Charles !
output: Li nostre deu, vengez nos de Carlun !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEn cette terre, il nous a mis de tels félons
output: En ceste tere nus ad mis tels feluns

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQue jamais pour mourir, ils ne quitteront le champ. »
output: Ja pur murir le camp ne guerpirunt. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'un dit à l'autre : « Eh ! Fuyons ! »
output: Dist l'un a l'altre : « E ! car nos en fuiums ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ ces mots, cent mille s'en vont,
output: A icest mot tels .C. milie s'en vunt,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQui les rappelle, jamais ne reviendront.
output: Ki ques rapelt, ja n'en returnerunt.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ quoi bon ? Marsile s'en est enfui,
output: De ço qui calt ? se fuït s'en est marsilies,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl est resté son oncle, Marganices,
output: Remés i est sis uncles, Marganices,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQui tenait Carthagène [au frère de Garmalie]
output: Ki tint Kartagene [al frere Garmalie]

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt l'Éthiopie, une terre maudite.
output: E Ethiope, une tere maldite.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl a sous son autorité les gens noirs ;
output: La neire gent en ad en sa baillie ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls ont de grands nez et de larges oreilles,
output: Granz unt les nés e lees les oreilles,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt ils sont ensemble plus de cinquante mille.
output: E sunt ensemble plus de cinquante milie.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls chevauchent fièrement et avec colère,
output: Icil chevalchent fierement e a ire,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPuis ils crient l'enseigne païenne.
output: Puis escrient l'enseigne paenime.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nRoland dit : « Ici, nous recevrons le martyre,
output: Ço dist Rollant : « Ci recevrums matyrie,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt maintenant je sais que nous n'avons guère à vivre ;
output: E or sai ben n'avons guaires a vivre ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMais que tout soit cher, ne se vende pas d'abord !
output: Mais tut seit fel cher ne se vende primes !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nFrappez, seigneurs, avec vos épées polies,
output: Ferez, seignurs, des espees furbies,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt réclamez vos morts et vos vies,
output: Si calengez e voz morz e voz vies,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQue la douce France ne soit pas déshonorée par nous !
output: Que dulce France par nus ne seit hunie !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQuand en ce champ viendra Charles, mon seigneur,
output: Quant en cest camp vendrat Carles, mi sire,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDes Sarrasins, il verra telle discipline
output: De Sarrazins verrat tel discipline

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nContre un des nôtres, il en trouvera quinze morts,
output: Cuntre un des noz en truverat morz .XV.,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl ne manquera pas de nous bénir. »
output: Ne lesserat que nos ne beneïsse. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQuand Roland voit les gens opposés
output: Quan rollant veit la contredite gent

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQui sont plus noirs que le charbon
output: Ki plus sunt neirs que nen est arrement

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt n'ont de blanc que les dents,
output: Ne n'unt de blanc ne mais que sul les denz,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe comte dit : « Maintenant, je sais vraiment
output: Ço dist li quens : « Or sai jo veirement

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQu'aujourd'hui nous mourrons par mon jugement.
output: Que hoi murrum par le mien escient.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nFrappez, Français, car je vous le recommande ! »
output: Ferez, Franceis, car jol vos recumenz ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nOlivier dit : « Malheur à celui qui est le plus lent ! »
output: Dist Oliver : « Dehet ait li plus lenz ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ ces mots, les Français se lancent.
output: A icest mot Franceis se fierent enz.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQuand les païens voient qu'il y a peu de Français,
output: Quant paien virent que franceis i out poi,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEntre eux, ils ont orgueil et réconfort.
output: Entr'els en unt e orgoil e cunfort.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'un dit à l'autre : « L'empereur a tort. »
output: Dist l'un a l'altre : « L'empereor ad tort. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMarganices est sur un cheval bai,
output: Li Marganices sist sur un ceval sor,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl le pousse bien avec les éperons d'or,
output: Brochet le ben des esperuns a or,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl frappe Olivier par derrière au milieu du dos.
output: Fiert Oliver derere en mi le dos.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLa cotte de mailles blanche, il la lui a décousue dans le corps,
output: Le blanc osberc li ad descust el cors,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPar le milieu de la poitrine, il lui enfonce sa lance,
output: Par mi le piz sun espiet li mist fors,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt dit ensuite : « Vous avez pris un coup fort !
output: E dit après : « Un col avez pris fort !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCharles le Grand vous a laissé aux ports !
output: Carles li Magnes mar vos laissat as porz !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl nous a fait tort, il n'est pas juste qu'il s'en vante,
output: Tort nos ad fait, nen est dreiz qu'il s'en lot,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCar de vous seul, j'ai bien vengé les nôtres. »
output: Kar de vos sul ai ben venget les noz. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nOlivier sent qu'il est frappé à mort.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl tient Hauteclaire, dont l'acier était brun,
output: Tient Halteclere, dunt li acer fut bruns,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl frappe Marganices sur le casque doré, aigu,
output: Fiert Marganices sur l'elme a or, agut,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt fleurs et cristaux s'écrasent en bas ;
output: E flurs e cristaus en acraventet jus ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl tranche la tête jusqu'aux petites dents,
