instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl brandit son coup, et l'a tué abattu,
output: Brandist sun colp, si l'ad mort abatut,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt dit ensuite : « Païen, malheur à toi !
output: E dist après : « Paien, mal aies tu !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJe ne dis pas que Charles n'y ait perdu.
output: Iço ne di que Karles n'i ait perdut.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl n'y a pas de femme ni de dame que tu aies vue
output: Ne a muiler ne a dame qu'aies veüd

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDont tu te vanteras dans le royaume d'où tu viens
output: N'en vanteras el regne dunt tu fus

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nD'avoir pris un denier de moi,
output: Vaillant a un dener que m'i aies tolut,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nNi fait de dommage ni de moi ni d'autrui. »
output: Ne fait damage ne de mei ne d'altrui. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAprès, il crie à Roland qu'il l'aide.
output: Après escriet Rollant qu'il li aiut.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nOlivier sent qu'il est blessé à mort.
output: Oliver sent qu'il est a mort nasfret.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe se venger, il ne sera jamais rassasié.
output: De lui venger ja mais ne li ert sez.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDans la grande presse, il frappe comme un brave,
output: En la grant presse or i fiert cume ber,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl tranche ces lances et ces boucliers,
output: Trenchet cez hanstes e cez escuz buclers

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt pieds et poings et selles et côtes.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQui le verrait démembrer des Sarrasins,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nUn mort sur l'autre jeter,
output: Un mort sur altre geter,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nD'un bon vassal, il pourrait se souvenir.
output: De bon vassal li poüst remembrer.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl ne veut pas oublier l'enseigne de Charles,
output: L'enseigne Carle n'i volt mie ublier,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Montjoie ! » il crie haut et clair,
output: « Munjoie ! » escriet e haltement e cler,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl appelle Roland, son ami et son pair :
output: Rollant apelet, sun ami e sun per :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Sire compagnon, venez à moi, car vous êtes juste !
output: « Sire cumpaign, a mei car vus justez !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAvec grande douleur, aujourd'hui nous serons séparés. »
output: A grant dulor ermes hoi desevrez. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nRoland regarde Olivier au visage :
output: Rollant reguardet oliver al visage :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl est pâle et livide, décoloré et pâle.
output: Teint fut e pers, desculuret e pale.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe sang clair lui coule par tout le corps,
output: Li sancs tuz clers par mi le cors li raiet,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nContre terre tombent les éclats.
output: Encuntre tere en cheent les esclaces.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Dieu ! » dit le comte, « maintenant je ne sais que faire.
output: « Deus ! » dist li quens, « or ne sai jo que face.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSire compagnon, votre bravoure fut grande !
output: Sire cumpainz, mar fut vostre barnage !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJamais homme ne vaudra votre corps.
output: Jamais n'iert hume ki tun cors cuntrevaillet.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÔ douce France, comme aujourd'hui tu resteras dévastée
output: E ! France dulce, cun hoi remendras guaste

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe bons vassaux, confondue et déchue !
output: De bons vassals, cunfundue e chaiete !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'empereur en aura grand dommage. »
output: Li emperere en avrat grant damage. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ ces mots, sur son cheval, il s'évanouit.
output: A icest mot sur sun cheval se pasmet.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nVoyez Roland sur son cheval évanoui
output: As vus rollant sur sun cheval pasmet

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt Olivier qui est blessé à mort.
output: E Oliver ki est a mort naffret.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl a tant saigné que ses yeux sont troublés.
output: Tant ad seinet li oil li sunt trublet.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nNi loin ni près, il ne peut voir si clair
output: Ne loinz ne près ne poet vedeir si cler

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQu'il puisse reconnaître nul homme mortel.
output: Que reconoistre poisset nuls hom mortel.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSon compagnon, comme il l'a rencontré,
output: Sun cumpaignun, cum il l'at encuntret,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl le frappe sur le casque doré,
output: Sil fiert amunt sur l'elme a or gemet,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl lui tranche tout d'ici au nasal ;
output: Tut li detrenchet d'ici qu'al nasel ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMais dans la tête, il ne l'a pas blessé.
output: Mais en la teste ne l'ad mie adeset.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ ce coup, Roland l'a regardé,
output: A icel colp l'ad Rollant reguardet,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt lui a demandé doucement et suavement :
output: Si li demandet dulcement e suef :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Sire compagnon, l'avez-vous fait de gré ?
output: « Sire cumpain, faites le vos de gred ?

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nC'est Roland, qui tant vous aimait !
output: Ja est ço Rollant, ki tant vos soelt amer !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEn aucune manière, vous ne m'avez défié ! »
output: Par nule guise ne m'aviez desfiet ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nOlivier dit : « Maintenant, je vous entends parler.
output: Dist Oliver : « Or vos oi jo parler.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJe ne vous vois pas, que Dieu vous voie !
output: Jo ne vos vei, veied vus Damnedeu !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJe vous ai frappé, que Dieu me le pardonne ! »
output: Ferut vos ai, car le me pardunez ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nRoland répond : « Je n'ai rien de mal.
output: Rollant respunt : « Jo n'ai nient de mel.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJe vous pardonne ici et devant Dieu. »
output: Jol vos parduins ici e devant Deu. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ ces mots, l'un à l'autre a incliné.
output: A icel mot l'un a l'altre ad clinet.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPar tel amour, ils se sont séparés.
output: Par tel amur as les vus desevred.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nOlivier sent que la mort l'angoisse beaucoup.
output: Oliver sent que la mort mult l'angoisset.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSes deux yeux tournent dans sa tête,
output: Ansdous les oilz en la teste li turnent,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl perd l'ouïe et toute la vue ;
output: L'oïe pert e la veüe tute ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl descend à pied, se couche à terre,
output: Descent a piet, a la tere se culchet,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl réclame sa faute hautement,
output: Durement en halt si recleimet sa culpe,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nContre le ciel, il joint ses deux mains,
output: Cuntre le ciel ambesdous ses mains juintes,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt prie Dieu de lui donner le paradis
output: Si priet Deu que pareïs li dunget

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt bénisse Charles et la douce France,
output: E beneïst Karlun e France dulce,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSon compagnon Roland sur tous les hommes.
output: Sun cumpaignun Rollant sur tuz humes.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe cœur lui manque, le casque lui tombe,
output: Falt li le coer, le helme li embrunchet,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTout le corps tombe à terre.
output: Trestut le cors a la tere li justet.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe comte est mort, il ne se relève plus.
output: Morz est li quens, que plus ne se demuret.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nRoland le brave le pleure, il se lamente ;
output: Rollant li ber le pluret, sil duluset ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJamais en terre, vous n'entendrez plus dolent homme.
output: Jamais en tere n'orrez plus dolent hume.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMaintenant Roland voit que son ami est mort,
output: Or veit rollant que mort est sun ami,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nGisant à terre, le visage contre terre.
output: Gesir adenz, a la tere sun vis.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTrès doucement, il commence à le regretter :
output: Mult dulcement a regreter le prist :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Sire compagnon, tant vous fûtes hardi !
output: « Sire cumpaign, tant mar fustes hardiz !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEnsemble, nous avons été des années et des jours,
output: Ensemble avum estet e anz e dis,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJe ne vous fis jamais de mal, ni vous ne me fîtes de tort.
output: Nem fesis mal ne jo nel te forsfis.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQuand vous êtes mort, c'est douleur que je vive. »
output: Quant tu es mor, dulur est que jo vif. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ ces mots, le marquis s'évanouit
output: A icest mot se pasmet li marchis

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSur son cheval qu'il appelle Veillantif.
output: Sur sun ceval que cleimet Veillantif.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl est bien attaché à ses étriers d'or fin :
output: Afermet est a ses estreus d'or fin :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nOù qu'il aille, il ne peut tomber.
output: Quel part qu'il alt, ne poet mie chaïr.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAvant que Roland ne se soit aperçu,
output: Ainz que rollant se seit aperceüt,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nGuéri de son évanouissement, il n'est pas revenu.
output: De pasmeisuns guariz ne revenuz.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nUn grand dommage lui est apparu :
output: Mult grant damage li est apareüt :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes Français sont morts, il les a tous perdus,
output: Morz sunt Franceis, tuz les i ad perdut,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSauf l'archevêque et Gautier de l'Hum.
output: Senz l'arcevesque e senz Gualter de l'Hum.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl est revenu des montagnes en bas ;
output: Repairez est des muntaignes jus ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ ceux d'Espagne, il s'est beaucoup battu ;
output: A cels d'Espaigne mult s'i est cumbatuz ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSes hommes sont morts, ils ont vaincu les païens ;
output: Mort sunt si hume, sis unt paiens vencut ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQu'il le veuille ou non, il fuit sous ces vallées,
output: Voeillet o nun, desuz cez vals s'en fuit,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt il appelle Roland, qu'il l'aide :
output: Si reclaimet Rollant, qu'il li aiut :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Ô gentil comte, vaillant homme, où es-tu ?
output: « E ! gentilz quens, vaillanz hom, u ies tu ?

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJamais je n'eus peur, là où tu étais.
output: Unkes nen oi poür, la u tu fus.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nC'est Gautier, qui conquit Maelgut,
output: Ço est Gualter, ki cunquist Maelgut,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe neveu de Droün, le vieux et le canut !
output: Li niés Droün, al vieill e al canut !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPour vaillance, il était ton ami.
output: Pur vasselage suleie estre tun drut.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nRoland a de la douleur, il est en colère ;
output: Rollant ad doel, si fut maltalentifs ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDans la grande presse, il commence à frapper.
output: En la grant presse cumencet a ferir.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe ceux d'Espagne, il a jeté vingt morts,
output: De cels d'Espaigne en ad getet mort .XX.,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt Gautier six et l'archevêque cinq.
output: E Gualter .VI. e l'arcevesque .V.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes païens disent : « Il y a ici des félons hommes !
output: Dient paien : « Feluns humes ad ci !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nGardez, seigneurs, qu'ils n'en aillent vivants.
output: Guardez, seignurs, qu'il n'en algent vif.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTout est félon qui les attaque
output: Tut par seit fel ki nes vait envaïr

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt lâche qui les laisse guérir ! »
output: E recreant ki les lerrat guarir ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAlors ils recommencent le cri et le cri ;
output: Dunc recumencent e le hu e le cri ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe toutes parts, ils reviennent les attaquer.
output: De tutes parz lé revunt envaïr.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe comte Roland était un noble guerrier,
output: Li quens rollant fut noble guerrer,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nGautier de l'Hum est un très bon chevalier,
output: Gualter de Hums est bien bon chevaler,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'archevêque est brave et éprouvé :
output: Li arcevesque prozdom e essaiet :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'un ne veut pas laisser l'autre.
output: Li uns ne volt l'altre nient laisser.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDans la grande presse, ils frappent les païens.
output: En la grant presse i fierent as paiens.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMille Sarrasins descendent à pied
output: Mil Sarrazins i descendent a piet

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt à cheval, ils sont quarante mille.
output: E a cheval sunt .XL. millers.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ mon avis, ils n'osent les approcher.
output: Men escientre nes osent aproismer.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls leur lancent des lances et des javelots
output: Il lor lancent e lances e espiez

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt des flèches et des dards et des javelots et des javelots.
output: E wigres e darz e museras e agiez e gieser.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAux premiers coups, ils ont tué Gautier,
output: As premers colps i unt ocis Gualter,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTurpin de Reims, tout son bouclier est percé,
output: Turpins de Reins tut sun escut percet,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSon casque est brisé, ils l'ont blessé à la tête,
output: Quasset sun elme, si l'unt nasfret el chef,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt sa cotte de mailles est rompue et démaillée,
output: E sun osberc rumput e desmailet,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPar le milieu du corps, blessé de quatre javelots ;
output: Par mi le cors nasfret de .IIII. espiez ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSous lui, ils tuent son destrier.
output: Dedesuz lui ocient sun destrer.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMaintenant, c'est grande douleur quand l'archevêque tombe.
output: Or est grant doel, quant l'arcevesque chiet.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTurpin de Reims, quand il se sent abattu,
output: Turpins de reins, quant se sent abatut,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe quatre javelots par le milieu du corps frappé,
output: De .IIII. espiez par mi le cors ferut,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nRapidement, le brave se relève,
output: Isnelement li ber resailit sus,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl regarde Roland, puis il court vers lui,
output: Rollant reguardet, puis si li est curut,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt dit un mot : « Je ne suis pas vaincu !
output: E dist un mot : « Ne sui mie vencut !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJamais bon vassal ne sera lâche vivant. »
output: Ja bon vassal nen ert vif recreüt. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl tire Almace, son épée d'acier brun,
output: Il trait Almace, s'espee d'acer brun,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDans la grande presse, il frappe mille coups et plus.
output: En la grant presse mil colps i fiert e plus.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPuis il dit à Charles qu'il n'épargna nul :
output: Puis le dist Carles qu'il n'en esparignat nul :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl en trouva quatre cents autour de lui,
output: Tels .IIII. cenz i troevet entur lui,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCertains blessés, certains par le milieu frappés,
output: Alquanz nafrez, alquanz par mi ferut,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl y en avait de ceux qui ont perdu la tête.
output: S'i out d'icels ki les chefs unt perdut.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDit la Geste et ceux qui étaient au champ ;
output: Ço dit la Geste e cil ki el camp fut ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe brave Gilie, pour qui Dieu fit vertu,
output: Li ber Gilie, por qui Deus fait vertuz,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt fit la charte au monastère de Loüm.
output: E fist la chartre el muster de Loüm.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQui ne sait tant, il ne l'a pas bien entendu.
output: Ki tant ne set ne l'ad prod entendut.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe comte Roland se bat gentiment,
output: Li quens rollant gentement se cumbat,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMais le corps est en sueur et très chaud.
output: Mais le cors ad tressuet e mult chalt.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDans la tête, il a douleur et grand mal :
output: En la teste ad e dulor e grant mal :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLa tempe est rompue, à cause qu'il a sonné le cor.
output: Rumput est li temples, por ço que il cornat.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMais il veut savoir si Charles viendra :
output: Mais saveir volt se Charles i vendrat :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl tire l'olifant, faiblement il le sonne.
output: Trait l'olifan, fieblement le sunat.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'empereur s'arrête, il l'écoute :
output: Li emperere s'estut, si l'escultat :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Seigneurs », dit-il, « cela va très mal pour nous !
output: « Seignurs », dist il, « mult malement nos vait !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nRoland, mon neveu, aujourd'hui nous manque.
output: Rollant mis niés hoi cest jur nus defalt.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJ'ai entendu au cor qu'il ne vivra guère.
output: Jo oi al corner que guaires ne vivrat.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQui veut être là, qu'il monte à cheval rapidement !
output: Ki estre i voelt isnelement chevalzt !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSonnez vos trompettes tant qu'il y en a dans cette armée ! »
output: Sunez voz grasles tant que en cest ost ad ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSoixante mille y sonnent si haut
output: Seisante milie en i cornent si halt

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes montagnes sonnent et les vallées répondent :
output: Sunent li munt e respondent li val :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes païens l'entendent, ils ne le prennent pas en moquerie ;
output: Paien l'entendent, nel tindrent mie en gab ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'un dit à l'autre : « Nous aurons Charles ! »
output: Dit l'un a l'altre : « Karlun avrum nus ja ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes païens disent : « L'empereur revient. Entendez les trompettes des Français !
output: Dient paien : « l'emperere repairet. de cels de france oez suner les graisles !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSi Charles vient, il y aura perte pour nous.
output: Se Carles vient, de nus i avrat perte.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSi Roland vit, notre guerre recommencera,
output: Se Rollant vit, nostre guerre novelet,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nNous avons perdu l'Espagne, notre terre. »
output: Perdud avuns Espaigne, nostre tere. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQuatre cents s'assemblent avec des casques,
output: Tels .IIII. cenz s'en asemblent a helmes,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt des meilleurs qui pensent être au champ :
output: E des meillors ki el camp quient estre :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls rendent à Roland une attaque forte et pesante.
output: A Rollant rendent un estur fort e pesme.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMaintenant, le comte a assez à faire.
output: Or ad li quens endreit sei asez que faire.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe comte Roland, quand il les voit venir,
output: Li quens rollant, quant il les veit venir,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl se fait fort et fier et manœuvrier !
output: Tant se fait fort e fiers e maneviz !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl ne les laissera pas tant qu'il sera vivant.
output: Ne lur lerat tant cum il serat vif.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl est sur le cheval qu'on appelle Veillantif,
output: Siet el cheval qu'om cleimet Veillantif,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl le pousse bien avec les éperons d'or fin,
output: Brochet le bien des esperuns d'or fin,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDans la grande presse, il va tous les attaquer,
output: En la grant presse les vait tuz envaïr,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEnsemble avec lui, l'archevêque Turpin.
output: Ensembl'od lui arcevesques Turpin.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'un dit à l'autre : « Venez ici, ami !
output: Dist l'un a l'altre : « Ça vus traiez, ami !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDes Français, nous avons entendu les cors :
output: De cels de France les corns avuns oït :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCharles revient, le roi puissant. »
output: Carles repairet, li reis poesteïfs. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe comte Roland n'a jamais aimé le lâche,
output: Li quens rollant unkes n'amat cuard,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nNi l'orgueilleux, ni le mauvais homme de mauvaise part,
output: Ne orguillos, ne malvais hume de male part,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nNi le chevalier, s'il n'était bon vassal.
output: Ne chevaler, s'il ne fust bon vassal.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'archevêque Turpin l'appelle :
output: Li arcevesques Turpin en apelat :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Sire, vous êtes à pied et je suis à cheval :
output: « Sire, a pied estes e jo sui a ceval :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPour votre amour, ici je prendrai position ;
output: Pur vostre amur ici prendrai estal ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEnsemble, nous aurons le bien et le mal,
output: Ensemble avruns e le ben e le mal,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJe ne vous laisserai pour nul homme de chair.
output: Ne vos lerrai pur nul hume de car.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAujourd'hui, nous rendrons aux païens cet assaut.
output: Encui rendruns a paiens cest asalt.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes meilleurs coups, ce sont ceux de Durandal. »
output: Les colps des mielz, cels sunt de Durendal. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'archevêque dit : « Maudit soit celui qui ne frappe pas bien !
output: Dist l'arcevesque : « Fel seit ki ben n'i ferrat !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCharles revient, qui nous vengera bien. »
output: Carles repairet, ki ben nus vengerat. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes païens disent : « Si mal nous sommes nés !
output: Paien dient : « si mare fumes nez !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQuel jour pesant nous est aujourd'hui arrivé !
output: Cum pesmes jurz nus est hoi ajurnez !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nNous avons perdu nos seigneurs et nos pairs ;
output: Perdut avum noz seignurs e noz pers ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCharles revient avec sa grande armée, le brave ;
output: Carles repeiret od sa grant ost, li ber ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDes Français, nous entendons les trompettes claires ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nGrand est le bruit de crier Montjoie.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJamais il ne sera vaincu par nul homme de chair.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls ont brisé et serré le bouclier de Roland

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMais Veillantif, ils l'ont blessé en trente endroits
output: Mais Veillantif unt en .XXX. lius nafret

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSur l'herbe verte, puis il l'a doucement couché.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Ô gentil homme, donnez-moi congé !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDevant vous, les aligner et les ranger. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'archevêque dit : « Allez et revenez !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nRoland se retourne, il va à travers le champ tout seul,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl cherche les vallées et il cherche les montagnes...

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLà, il trouve Gerin et Gerer son compagnon,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nUn par un, il les a pris, le baron,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl est venu à l'archevêque avec tous,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'archevêque ne peut s'empêcher de pleurer,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl lève sa main, fait sa bénédiction,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAprès, il dit : « Vous fûtes malheureux, seigneurs !
output: Après ad dit : « Mare fustes, seignurs !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQue Dieu le Glorieux ait toutes vos âmes !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMa mort me rend si angoissé !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJe ne verrai jamais le riche empereur. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nRoland se retourne, il va rechercher le champ,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl a trouvé son compagnon Olivier :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nContre sa poitrine, il l'a serré dans ses bras,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nComme il peut, il vient à l'archevêque,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nRoland dit : « Beau compagnon Olivier,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nVous fûtes le fils du duc Reiner

output: Li quens rollant, quant il veit mort ses pers

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSur son visage, il est très décoloré ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl a une si grande douleur qu'il ne peut plus rester :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl a alors une douleur qu'il n'a jamais eue si grande.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl tend sa main, il a pris l'olifant :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ Roncevaux, il y a une eau courante ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl veut y aller, il le donnera à Roland.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ petits pas, il se retourne en boitant.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl est si faible qu'il ne peut aller plus loin ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl n'a pas de force, il a trop perdu de sang.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAvant qu'on n'aille un seul arpent de champ,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe comte Roland revient de son évanouissement :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl regarde en bas et il regarde en haut :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nContre le ciel, il joint ses deux mains,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe comte Roland voit l'archevêque à terre :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Ô gentil homme, chevalier de bonne allure,

output: Dès les apostles ne fut hom tel prophete

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl va vers l'Espagne dans un guéret ;

output: Muntet sur un tertre ; desuz un arbre bel

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl y a quatre pierres de marbre ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSur l'herbe verte, il tombe à l'envers :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSon corps et son visage sont lavés de sang.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl se met debout et se prépare à courir.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt dit un mot : « Le neveu de Charles est vaincu !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt ils répondent doucement, par amour :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'empereur fait sonner ses trompettes,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl se couche à terre, il prie Dieu
output: Culchet sei a tere, si priet Damnedeu

output: Ais li un angle ki od lui soelt parler,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPour Charlemagne, Dieu a fait deux grandes vertus,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDans la vallée Ténébreuse, ils les atteignent,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ coups pleins, ils les tuent,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSes chevaliers ont un très grand échec,
