instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt les Français crient : « Charlemagne, aidez ! »
output: E Franceis crient : « Carlemagne, aidez ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe roi en a de la douleur et de la pitié ;
output: Li reis en ad e dulur e pitet ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl veut y aller, mais il est empêché :
output: Aler i volt, mais il ad desturber :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nVers un bois, un grand lion lui vient,
output: Devers un gualt uns granz leons li vient,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl est très pesant et orgueilleux et fier,
output: Mult par ert pesmes e orguillus e fiers,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSon propre corps, il attaque et demande
output: Sun cors meïsmes i asalt e requert

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt ils se prennent à bras pour lutter ;
output: E prenent sei a braz ambesdous por loiter ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMais il ne sait lequel abat ni lequel tombe.
output: Mais ço ne set liquels abat ne quels chiet.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'empereur n'est pas éveillé.
output: Li emperere n'est mie esveillet.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAprès cela, il lui vient une autre vision,
output: Après icel li vien un'altre avisiun,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQu'il est en France, à Aix, à un perron,
output: Qu'il ert en France, ad Ais, a un perrun,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDans deux chaînes, il tient un ours.
output: En dous chaeines si teneit un brohun.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nVers Ardenne, il voit venir trente ours,
output: Devers Ardene veeit venir .XXX. urs,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nChacun parle comme un homme,
output: Cascun parolet altresi cume hum,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls lui disent : « Sire, rendez-le-nous !
output: Diseient li : « Sire, rendez le nus !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl n'est pas juste qu'il soit plus avec vous ;
output: Il nen est dreiz que il seit mais od vos ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nNotre parent doit être à secours. »
output: Nostre parent devum estre a sucurs. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe son palais, un lévrier accourt :
output: De sun paleis uns veltres i acurt :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nParmi les autres, il attaque le plus grand
output: Entre les altres asaillit le greignur

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSur l'herbe verte, au-delà de ses compagnons.
output: Sur l'erbe verte, ultre ses cumpaignuns.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe roi voit une si merveilleuse bataille ;
output: La vit li reis si merveillus estur ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMais il ne sait lequel vainc ni lequel non.
output: Mais ço ne set liquels veint ne quels nun.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'ange de Dieu a montré cela au baron.
output: Li angles Deu ço ad mustret al barun.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCharles dort jusqu'au matin, au clair jour.
output: Carles se dort tresqu'al demain, al cler jur.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe roi Marsile s'enfuit à Saragosse.
output: Li reis marsilie s'en fuit en sarraguce.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSous un olivier, il est descendu à l'ombre.
output: Suz un'olive est descendut en l'umbre.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl rend son épée et son casque et sa cotte de mailles ;
output: S'espee rent e sun elme e sa bronie ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSur l'herbe verte, il se couche très laidement ;
output: Sur la verte herbe mult laidement se culcet ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl a perdu toute sa main droite ;
output: La destre main ad perdue trestute ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDu sang qui en sort, il s'évanouit et s'angoisse.
output: Del sanc qu'en ist se pasmet e angoiset.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDevant lui, sa femme Bramimonde
output: Dedevant lui sa muiller Bramimunde

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPleure et crie, elle se lamente très fort,
output: Pluret e criet, mult forment se doluset,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEnsemble avec lui, plus de vingt mille hommes,
output: Ensembl'od li plus de .XX. mil humes,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls maudissent Charles et la douce France.
output: Si maldient Carlun e France dulce.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls courent à Apollon dans une grotte,
output: Ad Apolin en curent en une crute,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls le maudissent, ils le méprisent laidement :
output: Tencent a lui, laidement le despersunent :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Ô mauvais dieu, pourquoi nous fais-tu telle honte ?
output: « E ! malvais deus, por quei nus fais tel hunte ?

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nC'est notre roi, pourquoi l'as-tu laissé confondre ?
output: C'est nostre rei por quei lessas cunfundre ?

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQui te sert beaucoup, mauvais salaire tu lui donnes ! »
output: Ki mult te sert, malvais luer l'en dunes ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPuis ils lui enlèvent son sceptre et sa couronne,
output: Puis si li tolent sun sceptre e sa curune,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls le pendent par les mains sur une colonne,
output: Par les mains le pendent sur une culumbe,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEntre leurs pieds, ils le renversent à terre,
output: Entre lur piez a tere le tresturnent,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls le battent à grands bâtons et le détruisent ;
output: A granz bastuns le batent e defruisent ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt ils enlèvent à Tervagant son escarboucle
output: E Tervagan tolent sun escarbuncle

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt ils mettent Mahomet dans un fossé
output: E Mahumet enz en un fosset butent

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt des porcs et des chiens le mordent et le dévorent.
output: E porc e chen le mordent e defulent.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe son évanouissement, Marsile est revenu,
output: De pasmeisuns en est venuz marsilies,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl se fait porter dans sa chambre voûtée ;
output: Fait sei porter en sa cambre voltice ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl y a plusieurs couleurs peintes et écrites ;
output: Plusurs culurs i ad peinz e escrites ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt Bramimonde le pleure, la reine,
output: E Bramimunde le pluret, la reïne,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nElle tire ses cheveux, elle se lamente captive,
output: Trait ses chevels, si se cleimet caitive,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ l'autre mot, elle crie très haut :
output: A l'altre mot mult haltement s'escriet :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Ô Saragosse, comme tu es aujourd'hui démunie
output: « E ! Sarraguce, cum ies oi desguarnie

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDu gentil roi qui t'avait en sa garde !
output: Del gentil rei ki t'aveit en baillie !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nNos dieux ont fait félonie,
output: Li nostre deu i unt fait felonie,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQui ce matin l'ont fait faillir en bataille.
output: Ki en bataille oi matin le faillirent.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'amiral fera lâcheté,
output: Li amiralz i ferat cuardie,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nS'il ne combat cette gent hardie
output: S'il ne cumbat a cele gent hardie

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQui sont si fiers, ils n'ont cure de leur vie.
output: Ki si sunt fiers n'unt cure de lur vies.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'empereur à la barbe fleurie
output: Li emperere od la barbe flurie

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nA du courage et une grande hardiesse ;
output: Vasselage ad e mult grant estultie ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nS'il a bataille, il ne fuira pas.
output: S'il ad bataille, il ne s'en fuirat mie.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nC'est une grande douleur qu'il n'y ait personne pour le tuer. »
output: Mult est grant doel que nen est ki l'ociet. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'empereur, par sa grande puissance,
output: Li emperere par sa grant poestet

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSept années pleines, il a été en Espagne ;
output: .VII. anz tuz plens ad en Espaigne estet ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl prend des châteaux et quelques cités.
output: Prent i chastels e alquantes citez.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe roi Marsile s'en est beaucoup préoccupé :
output: Li reis Marsilie s'en purcacet asez :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLa première année, il a fait sceller ses lettres,
output: Al premer an fist ses brefs seieler,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEn Babylonie, il a envoyé à Baligant,
output: En Babilonie Baligant ad mandet,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nC'est l'amiral, le vieux d'antiquité,
output: Ço est l'amiraill, le viel d'antiquitet,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl surpasse Virgile et Homère ;
output: Tut survesquiet e Virgilie e Omer ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEn Saragosse, il lui demande de le secourir
output: En Sarraguce alt sucurre li ber

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt, s'il ne le fait pas, il abandonnera ses dieux
output: E, s'il nel fait, il guerpirat ses deus

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt toutes ses idoles qu'il a l'habitude d'adorer,
output: E tuz ses ydeles que il soelt adorer,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl recevra la sainte chrétienté,
output: Si recevrat seinte chrestientet,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl voudra s'accorder avec Charlemagne.
output: A Charlemagne se vuldrat acorder.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt celui-ci est loin, il a beaucoup tardé ;
output: E cil est loinz, si ad mult demuret ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl a envoyé sa gent de quarante royaumes,
output: Mandet sa gent de .XL. regnez,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSes grands navires, il les a fait préparer,
output: Ses granz drodmunz en ad fait aprester,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDes esquifs et des barges et des galères et des navires ;
output: Eschiez e barges e galies e nefs ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSous Alexandre, à un port près de la mer,
output: Suz Alixandre, ad un port juste mer,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nToute sa flotte, il l'a fait préparer.
output: Tut sun navilie i ad fait aprester.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nC'est en mai, au premier jour d'été :
output: Ço est en mai, al premer jur d'ested :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nToutes ses armées, il les a lancées en mer.
output: Tutes ses oz ad empeintes en mer.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nGrandes sont les armées de cette gent adverse ;
output: Granz sunt les oz de cele gent averse ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls voguent à force et nagent et gouvernent.
output: Siglent a fort e nagent e guvernent.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSur ces mâts et sur ces hautes vergues
output: En sum cez maz e en cez haltes vernes

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl y a assez de carbuncles et de lanternes ;
output: Asez i ad carbuncles e lanternes ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLà-haut, ils projettent telle lumière
output: La sus amunt pargetent tel luiserne

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPar la nuit, la mer en est plus belle,
output: Par la noit la mer en est plus bele,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt comme ils viennent en terre d'Espagne,
output: E cum il vienent en Espaigne la tere,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTout le pays en reluit et éclaire.
output: Tut li païs en reluist e esclairet.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJusqu'à Marsile, les nouvelles parviennent.
output: Jesqu'a Marsilie en parvunt les noveles.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes païens ne veulent jamais cesser,
output: Gent paienor ne voelent cesser unkes,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls sortent de la mer, ils viennent aux eaux douces,
output: Issent de mer, venent as ewes dulces,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls laissent Marbrise et ils laissent Marbrose,
output: Laisent Marbrise e si laisent Marbrose,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPar l'Èbre en amont, ils tournent toute leur flotte.
output: Par Sebre amunt tut lur naviries turnent.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl y a assez de lanternes et de carbuncles :
output: Asez i ad lanternes e carbuncles :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nToute la nuit, ils leur donnent une grande clarté.
output: Tute la noit mult grant clartet lur dunent.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCe jour-là, ils viennent à Saragosse.
output: A icel jur venent a Sarraguce.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe jour est clair et le soleil luisant.
output: Clers est li jurz e li soleilz luisant.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'amiral est sorti du navire.
output: Li amiralz est issut del calan.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes Espagnols le guident dehors,
output: Espaneliz fors le vait adestrant,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDix-sept rois le suivent ;
output: .XVII. reis après le vunt siwant ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl y a bien des comtes et des ducs, je ne sais combien.
output: Cuntes e dux i ad ben ne sai quanz.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSous un laurier, qui est au milieu d'un champ,
output: Suz un lorer, ki est en mi un camp,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSur l'herbe verte, ils jettent un tapis blanc ;
output: Sur l'erbe verte getent un palie blanc ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nUn trône d'ivoire, ils ont mis dessus ;
output: Un faldestoed i unt mis d'olifan ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDessus s'assoit le païen Baligant.
output: Desur s'asiet li paien Baligant.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTous les autres restent debout.
output: Tuit li altre sunt remés en estant.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe seigneur d'eux parle le premier :
output: Li sire d'els premer parlat avant :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Écoutez maintenant, francs chevaliers vaillants !
output: « Oiez ore, franc chevaler vaillant !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCharles le roi, l'empereur des Francs,
output: Carles li reis, l'emperere des Francs,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nNe doit manger, si je ne le commande.
output: Ne deit manger, se jo ne li cumant.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPar toute l'Espagne, il m'a fait beaucoup de guerre.
output: Par tute Espaigne m'at fait guere mult grant.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEn douce France, je veux aller le chercher.
output: En France dulce le voeil aler querant.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJe ne finirai pas de toute ma vie
output: Ne finerai en trestut mun vivant

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJusqu'à ce qu'il soit mort ou tout vif lâche. »
output: Josqu'il seit mort u tut vif recreant. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSur son genou, il frappe son poing droit.
output: Sur sun genoill en fiert sun destre guant.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAprès qu'il a dit cela, il est très déterminé
output: Puis qu'il l'ad dit, mult s'en est afichet

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQu'il ne laissera pas pour tout l'or sous le ciel
output: Que ne lairat pur tut l'or desuz ciel

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQu'il n'aille à Aix, où Charles a l'habitude de plaider.
output: Qu'il n'alt ad Ais, o Carles soelt plaider.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSes hommes le louent, ils lui ont conseillé.
output: Si hume li lodent, si li unt cunseillet.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPuis il appelle deux de ses chevaliers,
output: Puis apelat dous de ses chevalers,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'un Clarifan et l'autre Clarïen :
output: L'un Clarifan e l'altre Clarïen :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Vous êtes les fils du roi Maltraïen,
output: « Vos estes filz al rei Maltraïen,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQui avait l'habitude de faire volontiers des messages.
output: Ki messages soleit faire volenters.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJe vous commande d'aller à Saragosse.
output: Jo vos cumant qu'en Sarraguce algez.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe ma part, annoncez à Marsile
output: Marsiliun de meie part li nunciez

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQue je suis venu l'aider contre les Français :
output: Cuntre Franceis li sui venut aider :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSi je le trouve, il y aura une grande bataille ;
output: Se jo truis o, mult grant bataille i ert ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDonnez-lui ce gant d'or plié,
output: Si l'en dunez cest guant ad or pleiet,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDans la main droite, faites-le lui chausser ;
output: El destre poign si li faites chalcer ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPortez-lui ce bâton d'or fin,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Sire empereur, » dit Geoffroi d'Anjou,
output: « sire emperere, » ço dist gefrei d'anjou,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Cette douleur ne la menez pas si fort !
output: « Ceste dolor ne demenez tant fort !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nFaites chercher nos morts sur le champ,
output: Par fut le camp faites querre les noz,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQue ceux d'Espagne ont tués dans la bataille.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDans un charnier, commandez qu'on les porte. »
output: En un carner cumandez qu'hom les port. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDit le roi : « Sonnez dans votre cor ! »
output: Co dist li reis : « Sunez en vostre corn ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nGeoffroi d'Anjou a son cor sonné.
output: Gefreid d'anjou ad sun greisle sunet.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes Français descendent, Charles l'a commandé.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTous leurs amis qu'ils ont trouvés morts là,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDans un charnier, ensemble, ils les ont portés.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl y a assez d'évêques et d'abbés,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMoines, chanoines, prévôts couronnés,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls les ont absous et bénis de la part de Dieu.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls ont fait allumer de la myrrhe et de l'encens,
output: Mirre e timonie i firent alumer,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nVigoureusement, ils les ont tous encensés :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAvec grand honneur, puis ils les ont enterrés,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls les ont laissés, que feraient-ils d'autre ?

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'empereur fait placer Roland
output: Li emperere fait rollant costeïr

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt Olivier et l'archevêque Turpin.
output: E Oliver e l'arcevesque Turpin.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDevant lui, il les a fait tous ouvrir
output: Devant sei les ad fait tuz uvrir

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt tous les cœurs et les étoffes recueillir :
output: E tuz les quers e paile recuillir :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDans un cercueil blanc de marbre, ils sont mis,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt puis les corps des barons, ils ont pris,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDans des peaux de cerf, les seigneurs ont mis ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMilun le comte et Otes le marquis :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Dans trois chariots, vous les guiderez... »
output: « En .III. carettes les guiez.… »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls sont bien couverts d'une étoffe de galazin.
output: Bien sunt cuverz d'un palie galazin.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'empereur Charles veut s'en aller,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQuand des païens surgissent les embuscades.
output: Quant de paiens li surdent les enguardes.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe ceux devant, deux messagers viennent,
output: De cels devant i vindrent dui messages,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe l'amiral, ils annoncent la bataille :
output: De l'amirail li nuncent la bataille :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Roi orgueilleux, il n'est pas temps que tu partes !
output: « Reis orguillos, nen est fins que t'en alges !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nVois Baligant, qui chevauche après toi.
output: Veiz Baligant, ki après tei chevalchet.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nGrandes sont les armées qu'il amène d'Arabie.
output: Granz sunt les oz qu'il ameinet d'Arabe.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAujourd'hui, nous verrons si tu as du courage. » Charles le roi a pris sa barbe,
output: Encoi verrum se tu as vasselage. » Carles li reis en ad prise sa barbe,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl se souvient de la douleur et du dommage,
output: Si li remembret del doel e del damage,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTrès fièrement, il regarde toute sa troupe,
output: Mult fierement tute sa gent reguardet,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPuis il s'écrie d'une voix forte et haute :
output: Puis si s'escriet a sa voiz grand e halte :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Barons français, aux chevaux et aux armes ! »
output: « Barons franceis, as chevals e as armes ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'empereur s'équipe le premier.
output: Li empereres tuz premereins s'adubet.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nRapidement, il a revêtu sa cotte de mailles,
output: Isnelement ad vestue sa brunie,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLace son casque, ceint Joyeuse,
output: Lacet sun helme, si ad ceinte Joiuse,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQui pour soleil, sa clarté ne change pas,
output: Ki pur soleill sa clartet n'en muet,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPendu à son cou, un écu de Biterne,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTient sa lance, fait brandir la hampe,
output: Tient sun espiet, sin fait brandir la hanste,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSur Tencendur, son bon cheval, il monte
output: En Tencendur, sun bon cheval, puis muntet

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n— Il l'a conquis aux gués sous Marsune,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl a jeté mort Malpalin de Narbonne, —
output: Sin getat mort Malpalin de Nerbone, —

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLâche la bride, souvent il l'éperonne,
output: Laschet la resne, mult suvent l'esperonet,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nFait son élan, devant cent mille hommes, Il invoque Dieu et l'apôtre de Rome.
output: Fait sun eslais, veant cent mil humes, Recleimet Deu e l'apostle de Rome.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSur le champ, les Français descendent.
output: Par fut le champ cil de france descendent.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPlus de cent mille s'équipent ensemble.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls ont des équipements qui leur plaisent bien,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDes chevaux rapides et leurs armes très belles,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPuis ils montent et ont grande science.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nS'ils trouvent aujourd'hui, ils pensent livrer bataille.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLeurs bannières pendent sur leurs casques.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQuand Charles voit de si belles apparences,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl appelle Jozeran de Provence,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nNaimes le duc, Antelme de Mayence :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« En tels vassaux, on doit avoir confiance !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAssez est fou celui qui entre eux se dément.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSi les Arabes ne se repentent de venir,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLa mort de Roland, ils pensent chèrement rendre. »

output: Respunt dux Neimes : « E Deus le nos cunsente ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCharles appelle Rabel et Guineman.
output: Carles apelet rabel e guineman.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDit le roi : « Seigneurs, je vous commande,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEnsemble avec vous, quinze mille Français,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe jeunes gens, de nos meilleurs vaillants.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAprès ceux-là, il y en aura autant,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nNaimes le duc et le comte Jozeran
output: Naimes li dux e li quens Jozerans

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCes escadrons, ils les ajustent bien.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nS'ils trouvent aujourd'hui, la bataille sera très grande.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes Français sont les premiers escadrons.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAprès les deux, ils établissent le troisième.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ vingt mille chevaliers, ils l'ont estimé ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJamais de leur côté, la bataille ne sera laissée.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe comte Ogier le Danois, le plus jeune,

output: Naimes li dux puis establist la quarte

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe tels barons qui ont assez de vaillance :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCe sont des Allemands et ils sont d'Allemagne ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nVingt mille sont-ils, disent tous les autres.

output: Naimes li dux e li quens jozerans

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls ont de belles armes et de bons chevaux rapides ;
output: Armes unt beles e bons cevals curanz ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJamais pour mourir, ils ne seront lâches.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSous le ciel, il n'y a pas de gens qui puissent plus au combat.
output: Suz ciel n'ad gent ki plus poissent en camp.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nRichard le vieux les guidera au champ ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCelui-là frappera de sa lance tranchante.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe sixième escadron est fait de Bretons :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTrente mille chevaliers avec eux.
output: .XXX. milie chevalers od els unt.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCeux-ci chevauchent en guise de barons,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe seigneur d'eux est appelé Oedun :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe Poitevins et des barons d'Auvergne :

output: Entre Rembalt e Hamon de Galice

output: Entre naimon et jozeran le cunte

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe neuvième escadron est fait de preux hommes,

output: Cil sunt seiet ensement cume porc ; E la terce est de Nubles e de Blos,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'amiral en jure tout ce qu'il peut
output: Li amiralz en juret quanqu'il poet

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPar les vertus et le corps de Mahomet :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Charles de France chevauche comme un fou.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl y aura bataille, s'il ne se détourne ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDix escadrons établissent après.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe premier est des Canelius les laids :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt le septième est du peuple Samuel,

output: L'oidme est de Bruise e la noefme de Clavers,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt le dixième est d'Occian le désert :
output: E la disme est d'Occian la desert :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nC'est un peuple qui ne sert pas Dieu ;
output: Ço est une gent ki Damnedeu ne sert ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe plus félons, vous n'entendrez jamais parler ;
output: De plus feluns n'orrez parler jamais ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls ont les cœurs durs comme le fer ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nC'est pourquoi ils n'ont pas besoin de casque ni de haubert ;
output: Pur ço n'unt soign de elme ne d'osberc ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDans la bataille, ils sont félons et enragés.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'amiral a ajusté dix escadrons.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes Français comptent trente escadrons.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nGrandes sont les armées où ces trompettes sonnent.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes païens chevauchent en guise de preux hommes.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'amiral est un homme très riche.
output: Li amiralz mult par est riches hoem.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDevant lui, il fait porter son dragon
output: Dedavant sei fait porter sun dragon

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt l'étendard Tervagan et Mahomet
output: E l'estandart Tervagan e Mahum

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt une image d'Apolin le félon.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDes Canelius chevauchent autour ;
output: Des Canelius chevalchent envirun ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTrès hautement, ils crient un sermon :
output: Mult haltement escrient un sermun :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Qui par nos dieux veut avoir guérison,
output: « Ki par noz deus voelt aveir guarison,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQu'il prie et serve par grande affliction ! »
output: Sis prit e servet par grant afflictiun ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes païens y baissent leurs têtes et leurs mentons,
output: Paien i bassent lur chefs e lur mentun,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLeurs casques clairs, ils inclinent en brunissant.
output: Lor helmes clers i suzclinent enbrunc.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes Français disent : « Vous mourrez toujours, gloutons !
output: Dient Franceis : « Sempres murrez, glutun !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQue de vous soit aujourd'hui grande confusion !
output: De vos seit hoi male confusion !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nNotre Dieu, protégez Charles !
output: Li nostre Deu, guarantisez Carlun !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'amiral est très savant ;
output: Li amiralz est mult de grant saveir ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl appelle à lui son fils et les deux rois :
output: A sei apelet sis filz e les dous reis :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Seigneurs barons, vous chevaucherez devant.
output: « Seignurs barons, devant chevalchereiz.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMes escadrons, vous les guiderez tous ;
output: Mes escheles, tutes les guiereiz ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMais des meilleurs, je veux en retenir trois :
output: Mais des meillors voeill jo retenir treis :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'un sera de Turcs et l'autre d'Ormaleis
output: L'un'ert de Turcs e l'altre d'Ormaleis

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt le troisième est des géants de Malpris.
output: E la terce est des jaianz de Malpreis.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCeux d'Occian seront ensemble avec moi,
output: Cil d'Ociant ierent esembl'ot mei,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls combattront Charles et les Français.
output: Si justerunt a Charles e a Franceis.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'empereur, s'il se bat avec moi,
output: Li emperere, s'il se cumbat od mei,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSur le bouclier, il doit perdre la tête.
output: Desur le buc la teste perdre en deit.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTout soit fait, il n'y aura pas d'autre droit. »
output: Trestut seit fiz, n'i avrat altre dreit. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nGrandes sont les armées et les escadrons beaux.
output: Granz sunt les oz e les escheles beles.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEntre eux, il n'y a ni colline ni vallée ni tertre,
output: Entr'els nen at ne pui ne val ne tertre,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nForêt ni bois ; caché, il ne peut être ;
output: Selve ne bois ; asconse n'i poet estre ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls se voient bien au milieu de la pleine terre.
output: Ben s'entreveient en mi la pleine tere.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDit Baligant : « Ma troupe adverse,
output: Dist Baligant : « La meie gent averse,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCar chevauchez pour chercher la bataille ! »
output: Car chevalchez pur la bataille quere ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'enseigne porte Amborres d'Oluferne.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes païens crient, ils l'appellent Preciuse.
output: Paien escrient, Preciuse l'apelent.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes Français disent : « Que de vous soit aujourd'hui grande perte ! »
output: Dient Franceis : « De vos seit hoi grant perte ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTrès hautement, ils renouvellent Montjoie.
output: Mult haltement Munjoie renuvelent.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'empereur fait sonner ses cors
output: Li emperere i fait suner ses greisles

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt l'olifant, qui éclaire tous.
output: E l'olifan, ki trestuz les esclairet.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes païens disent : « La troupe de Charles est belle.
output: Dient paien : « La gent Carlun est bele.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nNous aurons bataille, dure et terrible. »
output: Bataille avrum e aduree e pesme. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nGrande est la plaine et large la contrée.
output: Grant est la plaigne e large la cuntree.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nBrillent ces casques aux pierres d'or gemmées
output: Luisent cil elme as perres d'or gemmees

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt ces écus et ces cottes de mailles safranées
output: E cez escuz e cez bronies safrees

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt ces lances, ces enseignes fermées.
output: E cez espiez, cez enseignes fermees.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCes cors sonnent, leurs voix sont très claires ;
output: Sunent cez greisles, les voiz en sunt mult cleres ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe l'olifant, les sons sont hauts.
output: De l'olifan haltes sunt les menees.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'amiral appelle son frère,
output: Li amiralz en apelet sun frere,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nC'est Canabeus, le roi de Floredee :
output: Ço est Canabeus, li reis de Floredee :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCelui-là tenait la terre jusqu'en Val Sevree.
output: Cil tint la terre entresqu'en Val Sevree.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes escadrons de Charles, il lui a montrés :
output: Les escheles Charlun li ad mustrees :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Voyez l'orgueil de la France louée !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTrès fièrement chevauche l'empereur.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl est derrière avec cette troupe barbue :
output: Il est darere od cele gent barbee :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSur leurs cottes de mailles, ils ont jeté leurs barbes
output: Desur lur bronies lur barbes unt getees

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAussi blanches que neige sur gelée.
output: Altresi blanches cume neif sur gelee.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCeux-ci frapperont de lances et d'épées.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nNous aurons bataille, forte et dure :
output: Bataille avrum e forte e aduree :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJamais homme ne vit telle ajustée. »
output: Unkes nuls hom ne vit tel ajustee. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPlus qu'on ne lance une verge pelée,
output: Plus qu'om ne lancet une verge pelee,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nBaligant a passé ses compagnons.
output: Baligant ad ses cumpaignes trespassees.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nUne raison leur a dite et montrée :
output: Une raison lur a dit'e mustree :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Venez, païens, car j'irai dans l'allée. »
output: « Venez, paien, kar jon irai en l'estree. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe sa lance, il a brandi la hampe,
output: De sun espiet la hanste en ad branlee,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nVers Charles, il a tourné la pointe.
output: Envers Karlun la mure en ad turnee.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCharles le grand, quand il voit l'amiral
output: Carles li magnes, cum il vit l'amiraill

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt le dragon, l'enseigne et l'étendard,
output: E le dragon, l'enseigne e l'estandart,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n— De ceux d'Arabie, il y a une si grande force,
output: — De cels d'Arabe si grant force i par ad,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe la contrée, ils ont pris les parts
output: De la contree unt porprises les parz

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPas plus que tant que l'empereur en a, —
output: Ne mès que tant cume l'empereres en ad, —

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe roi de France s'écrie très haut :
output: Li reis de France s'en escriet mult halt :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Barons français, vous êtes de bons vassaux.
output: « Barons franceis, vos estes bons vassals.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTant de batailles avez faites en champs !
output: Tantes batailles avez faites en camps !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nVoyez, les païens félons sont et couards.
output: Veez, paien felun sunt e cuart.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nToutes leurs lois ne valent pas un denier.
output: Tutes lor leis un dener ne lur valt.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nS'ils ont grande troupe, de cela, seigneurs, qui s'en soucie ?
output: S'il unt grant gent, d'iço, seignurs, qui calt ?

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQui ne veut pas venir avec moi, qu'il s'en aille ! »
output: Ki or ne voelt a mei venir s'en alt ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDes éperons, il éperonne le cheval,
output: Des esperons puis brochet le cheval,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt Tencendur lui fait quatre sauts.
output: E Tencendor li ad fait .IIII. salz.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes Français disent : « Ce roi est vassal !
output: Dient Franceis : « Icist reis est vassals !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nChevauchez, preux ! Aucun de nous ne vous manque. »
output: Chevalchez, bers ! Nul de nus ne vus falt. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe jour était clair et le soleil brillant.
output: Clers fut li jurz e li soleilz luisanz.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes armées sont belles et les compagnies grandes.
output: Les oz sunt beles e les cumpaignes granz.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes escadrons sont ajustés devant.
output: Justees sunt les escheles devant.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe comte Rabel et le comte Guineman
output: Li quens Rabels e li quens Guinemans

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLâchent les rênes à leurs chevaux rapides,
output: Lascent les resnes a lor cevals curanz,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls éperonnent à huit. Alors les Français laissent courir,
output: Brochent a eit. Dunc laisent curre Francs,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls vont frapper de leurs lances tranchantes.
output: Si vunt ferir de lur espiez trenchanz.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe comte Rabel est chevalier hardi.
output: Li quens rabels est chevaler hardiz.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl éperonne le cheval des éperons d'or fin,
output: Le cheval brochet des esperuns d'or fin,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl va frapper Torleu, le roi persan.
output: Si vait ferir Torleu, le rei persis.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nNi écu ni cotte de mailles ne peut tenir son coup :
output: N'escut ne bronie ne pout sun colp tenir :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLa lance d'or, il l'a mise dans le corps,
output: L'espiet a or li ad enz el cors mis,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQu'il le renverse mort sur un petit buisson.
output: Que mort l'abat sur un boissun petit.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes Français disent : « Dieu nous aide !
output: Dient Franceis : « Damnesdeus nos aït !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCharles a raison, nous ne devons pas lui faillir. »
output: Carles ad dreit, ne li devom faillir. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt Guineman a jouté à un roi loyal.
output: E guineman justet a un rei leutice.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl brise tout son écu, qui est fleuri ;
output: Tute li freint la targe, ki est flurie ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAprès, il a défait sa cotte de mailles ;
output: Après li ad la bronie descunfite ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl a mis toute l'enseigne dans le corps,
output: Tute l'enseigne li ad enz el cors mise,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQu'il le renverse mort, qui pleure ou qui rit.
output: Que mort l'abat, ki qu'en plurt u kin riet.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ ce coup, les Français s'écrient :
output: A icest colp cil de France s'escrient :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Frappez, barons, ne tardez pas !
