instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDieu nous a mis au plus vrai jugement. »
output: Deus nus ad mis al plus verai juise. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMalpramis est assis sur un cheval tout blanc ;
output: Malpramis siet sur un cheval tut blanc ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl conduit son corps dans la presse des Français,
output: Cunduit sun cors en la presse des Francs,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nD'heure en heure, il y frappe de grands coups,
output: D'ures es altres granz colps i vait ferant,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'un mort sur l'autre, souvent il renverse.
output: L'un mort sur l'altre suvent vait tresturnant.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTout d'abord, Baligant s'écrie :
output: Tut premereins s'escriet Baligant :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Mes barons, je vous ai nourris longtemps.
output: « Li mien baron, nurrit vos ai lung tens.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nVoyez mon fils, il cherche Charles,
output: Veez mun filz, Carlun vait querant,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ ses armes, tant de barons l'accusent :
output: A ses armes tanz barons calunjant :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMeilleur vassal que lui, jamais je ne demande.
output: Meillor vassal de lui ja ne demant.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSecourez-le avec vos lances tranchantes ! »
output: Succurez le a voz espiez trenchant ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ ce mot, les païens viennent en avant,
output: A icest mot paien venent avant,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls frappent de durs coups, la mêlée est grande.
output: Durs colps i fierent, mult est li caples granz.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLa bataille est merveilleuse et pesante :
output: La bataille est merveilleuse e pesant :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nElle ne fut jamais si forte avant ni après ce temps.
output: Ne fut si fort enceis ne puis cet tens.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nGrandes sont les armées et les compagnies fières,
output: Granz sunt les oz e les cumpaignes fieres,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes escadrons sont tous ajustés,
output: Justees sunt trestutes les escheles,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt les païens frappent merveilleusement.
output: E li paien merveillusement fierent.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDieu ! Tant de lances y sont brisées,
output: Deus ! tantes hanstes i ad par mi brisees,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÉcus fracassés et cottes de mailles démaillées !
output: Escuz fruisez e bronies desmaillees !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLà, vous auriez vu la terre si jonchée !
output: La veïsez la tere si junchee !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'amiral appelle sa maisonnée :
output: Li amiralz recleimet sa maisnee :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Frappez, barons, sur la gent chrétienne ! »
output: Ferez, baron, sur la gent chrestiene ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLa bataille est très dure et acharnée ;
output: La bataille est mult dure e afichee ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJamais avant ni après, elle ne fut si forte ;
output: Unc einz ne puis ne fut si fort ajustee ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJusqu'à la nuit, il n'y aura pas de fin accordée.
output: Josqu'a la nuit n'en ert fins otriee.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'amiral appelle sa troupe :
output: Li amiralz la sue gent apelet :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Frappez, païens : pour elle, vous êtes venus !
output: « Ferez, paien : por el venud n'i estes !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJe vous donnerai des femmes belles et nobles,
output: Jo vos durrai muillers gentes e beles,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJe vous donnerai feux et honneurs et terres. »
output: Si vos durai feus e honors e teres. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes païens répondent : « Nous devons bien le faire. »
output: Paien respundent : « Nus le devuns ben fere. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ coups pleins de leurs lances, ils perdent :
output: A colps pleners de lor espiez i perdent :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPlus de cent mille épées y sont tirées.
output: Plus de cent milie espees i unt traites.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAyez pitié de la mêlée douloureuse et pesante ;
output: Ais vos le caple e dulurus e pesmes ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nBataille voit celui qui voit être entre eux.
output: Bataille veit cil ki entr'els voit estre.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'empereur appelle ses Français :
output: Li emperere recleimet ses franceis :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Seigneurs barons, je vous aime, je vous crois.
output: « Seignors barons, jo vos aim, si vos crei.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTant de batailles avez faites pour moi,
output: Tantes batailles avez faites pur mei,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nRoyaumes conquis et rois désordonnés !
output: Regnes cunquis e desordenet reis !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJe sais bien que je dois vous récompenser
output: Ben le conuis que gueredun vos en dei

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt de mon corps, de terres et de biens.
output: E de mun cors, de teres e d'aveir.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nVengez vos fils, vos frères et vos héritiers,
output: Vengez voz filz, voz freres e voz heirs,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQui à Roncevaux furent morts l'autre soir !
output: Qu'en Rencesvals furent morz l'altre seir !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nVous savez bien que contre les païens, j'ai raison. »
output: Ja savez vos cuntre paiens ai dreit. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nRépondent les Français : « Seigneur, vous dites vrai. »
output: Respondent Franc : « Sire, vos dites veir. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTels vingt mille, il en a avec lui
output: Itels .XX. miliers en ad od sei

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCommunément, ils lui promettent leur foi
output: Cumunement l'en prametent lor feiz

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls ne lui failliront pour mort ni pour détresse.
output: Ne li faldrunt pur mort ne pur destreit.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl n'y en a pas cent qui n'emploient leur lance ;
output: N'en i ad cet sa lance n'i empleit ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe leurs épées, ils frappent de toutes parts ;
output: De lur espees i fierent demaneis ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLa bataille est d'une merveilleuse détresse.
output: La bataille est de merveillus destreit.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt Malpramis chevauche le champ ;
output: E malpramis par roi le camp chevalchet ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDes Français, il fait un très grand dommage.
output: De cels de France i fait mult grant damage.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nNaimes le duc le regarde fièrement,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl va le frapper comme un homme vertueux.
output: Vait le ferir cum hume vertudable.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl brise son écu, il lui casse la pointe haute,
output: De sun escut li freint la pene halte,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl lui déchire les deux pans de son haubert,
output: De sun osberc les dous pans li desaffret,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDans le corps, il met toute l'enseigne jaune,
output: El cors li met tute l'enseigne jalne,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQu'il le renverse mort parmi sept cents autres.
output: Que mort l'abat entre .VII. C. des altres.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe roi Canabeus, le frère de l'amiral,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÉperonne bien son cheval ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl tire l'épée, la pointe est de cristal,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl frappe Naimes sur le casque principal.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl en brise une moitié d'un côté ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDu tranchant d'acier, il coupe cinq des lanières.
output: Al brant d'acer l'en trenchet .V. des laz.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe capuchon ne vaut pas un denier :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl coupe la coiffe jusqu'à la chair,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJusqu'à terre, il en abat un morceau.
output: Jus a la tere une piece en abat.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe coup fut grand, le duc en est étonné :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl serait tombé, si Dieu ne l'avait aidé.
output: Sempres caïst, se Deus ne li aidast.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl embrasse le cou de son destrier.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSi le païen avait frappé une fois de plus,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe noble vassal serait mort.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCharles de France y vient, il le secourt.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nNaimes le duc est si angoissé,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt le païen de frapper se hâte beaucoup.
output: E li paiens de ferir mult le hastet.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCharles lui dit : « Lâche, mal tu l'as donné ! »
output: Carles li dist : « Culvert, mar le baillastes ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl va le frapper par sa grande vaillance :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl brise son écu, contre le cœur, il le casse,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl lui déchire la ventaille de son haubert,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCharles le roi a une grande douleur,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQuand il voit Naimes blessé devant lui,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSur l'herbe verte, le sang tout clair tomber.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'empereur lui dit en conseil :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Beau sire Naimes, chevauchez avec moi !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMort est le lâche qui vous tenait en détresse ;
output: Morz est li gluz ki en destreit vus teneit ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDans le corps, j'ai mis ma lance une fois. »
output: El cors li mis mun espiet une feiz. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nRépond le duc : « Seigneur, je vous crois.
output: Respunt li dux : « Sire, jo vos en crei.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSi je vis encore, vous aurez grand profit. »
output: Se jo vif alques, mult grant prod i avreiz. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPuis ils sont ajustés par amour et par foi,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEnsemble avec eux, tels vingt mille Français
output: Ensembl'od els tels .XX. milie Franceis

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl n'y a pas celui qui n'y frappe ou n'y combat.
output: N'i ad celoi que n'i fierge o n'i capleit.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'amiral chevauche par le champ,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl va frapper le comte Guneman.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQu'il le renverse mort de son cheval rapide.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPuis il a tué Gebuin et Lorant,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nRichard le vieux, le seigneur des Normands.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes païens crient : « Preciuse est vaillante !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nFrappez, barons, nous avons garantie ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQui ensuite verrait les chevaliers d'Arabie,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCeux d'Occian et d'Argolie et de Bascle !
output: Cels d'Occiant e d'Argoillie e de Bascle !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe leurs lances, ils frappent bien et combattent.
output: De lur espiez ben i fierent e caplent.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt les Français n'ont pas l'intention de s'en aller ;
output: E li Franceis n'unt talent que s'en algent ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAssez y meurent et des uns et des autres.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJusqu'au soir, la bataille est très forte ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDes francs barons, il y a un très grand dommage ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl y aura deuil, avant qu'elle ne se termine.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTrès bien frappent les Français et les Arabes.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls brisent ces lances et ces lances polies.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQui alors verrait ces écus si malmenés,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCes cottes de mailles blanches qui alors entendrait frémir
output: Cez blancs osbercs ki dunc oïst fremir

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt ces écus sur ces casques croiser,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCes chevaliers qui alors verrait tomber
output: Cez chevalers ki dunc veïst caïr

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt hommes crier, contre terre mourir,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe grande douleur, il pourrait se souvenir !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCette bataille est très forte à supporter.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nVous avez perdu Malpramis, votre fils,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt Canabeus, votre frère, est tué ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ deux Français, cela est bien arrivé.
output: A dous Franceis belement en avint.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'empereur en est l'un, il me semble :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl a le corps grand, il ressemble bien à un marquis,
output: Granz ad le cors, ben resenblet marchis,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'amiral en a le casque incliné
output: Li amiralz en ad le helme enclin

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt ensuite, il a bruné son visage.
output: E en après sin enbrunket sun vis.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl a une si grande douleur qu'il tombe presque mort,
output: Si grant doel ad sempres quiad murir,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl appelle Jangleu l'outremer.
