instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDit l'amiral : « Jangleu, venez en avant !
output: Dist l'amiraill : « jangleu, venez avant !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAurons-nous la victoire du champ ? »
output: Avrum nos la victorie del champ ? »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt celui-ci répond : « Vous êtes mort, Baligant !
output: E cil respunt : « Morz estes, Baligant !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJamais vos dieux ne vous seront garants.
output: Ja vostre deu ne vos erent guarant.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCharles est fier et ses hommes vaillants ;
output: Carles est fiers e si hume vaillant ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJe n'ai jamais vu de gens qui fussent si combattants.
output: Unc ne vi gent ki si fust cumbatant.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMais appelez les barons d'Occian,
output: Mais reclamez les barons d'Occiant,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTurcs et Enfruns, Arabes et Géants.
output: Turcs e Enfruns, Arabiz e Jaianz.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCe qui doit être, ne le retardez pas. »
output: Ço qu'estre en deit, ne l'alez demurant. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'amiral a mis sa barbe dehors,
output: Li amiraill ad sa barbe fors mise,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAussi blanche que fleur en épine :
output: Altresi blanche cume flur en espine :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQuoi qu'il en soit, il ne veut pas se cacher.
output: Cument qu'il seit, ne s'i voelt celer mie.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl met à sa bouche une trompette claire,
output: Met a sa buche une clere buisine,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl la sonne claire, que ses païens l'entendent ;
output: Sunet la cler, que si paien l'oïrent ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPar tout le champ, ses compagnons se rallient.
output: Par tut le camp ses cumpaignes ralient.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCeux d'Occian y braient et hennissent,
output: Cil d'Ociant i braient e hennissent,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nArguille comme chiens y glapissent ;
output: Arguille si cume chen i glatissent ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls attaquent les Français avec une si grande fureur,
output: Requerent Franc par si grant estultie,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDans le plus épais, ils se rompent et se séparent.
output: El plus espès ses rumpent e partissent.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ ce coup, ils jettent morts sept mille.
output: A icest colp en jetent mort .VII. milie.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe comte Ogier n'a jamais eu de lâcheté ;
output: Li quens oger cuardise n'out unkes ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMeilleur vassal que lui ne revêtit cotte de mailles.
output: Meillor vassal de lui ne vestit bronie.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQuand il vit les escadrons des Français se rompre,
output: Quant de Franceis les escheles vit rumpre,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl appelle Tierri, le duc d'Argonne,
output: Si apelat Tierri, le duc d'Argone,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nGeoffroi d'Anjou et Jozeran le comte ;
output: Gefrei d'Anjou e Jozeran le cunte ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTrès fièrement, il parle à Charles :
output: Mult fierement Carlun en araisunet :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Voyez les païens comme ils tuent vos hommes !
output: « Veez paien cum ocient voz humes !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQue Dieu ne veuille que vous portiez couronne,
output: Ja Deu ne placet qu'el chef portez corone,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSi maintenant vous n'y faites pour venger votre honte ! »
output: S'or n'i ferez pur venger vostre hunte ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl n'y a pas celui qui répond un seul mot ;
output: N'i ad icel ki un sul mot respundet ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls éperonnent à huit, laissent courir leurs chevaux,
output: Brochent ad eit, lor cevals laissent cure,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls vont les frapper là où ils les rencontrent.
output: Vunt les ferir la o il les encuntrent.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTrès bien frappe Charles le roi de France,
output: Mult ben i fiert carlemagnes li reis,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nNaimes le duc et Ogier le Danois,
output: Naimes li dux e Oger li Daneis,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nGeoffroi d'Anjou, qui tenait l'enseigne.
output: Geifreid d'Anjou, ki l'enseigne teneit.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTrès preux est le seigneur Ogier le Danois :
output: Mult par est proz danz Ogers li Daneis :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl éperonne le cheval, le laisse courir à l'exploit,
output: Puint le ceval, laisset curre ad espleit,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl va frapper celui qui tenait le dragon,
output: Si vait ferir celui ki le dragun teneit,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQu'Ambure renverse sur la place devant lui
output: Qu'Ambure cravente en la place devant sei

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt le dragon et l'enseigne du roi.
output: E le dragon e l'enseigne le rei.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nBaligant voit son gonfanon tomber
output: Baligant veit sun gunfanun cadeir

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt l'étendard Mahomet rester :
output: E l'estandart Mahumet remaneir :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'amiral s'aperçoit quelque peu
output: Li amiralz alques s'en aperceit

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQu'il a tort et Charles a raison.
output: Que il ad tort e Carlemagnes dreit.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'empereur appelle ses Français :
output: Li emperere recleimet ses Franceis :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Dites, barons, par Dieu, si vous m'aiderez. »
output: « Dites, baron, por Deu, si m'aidereiz. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nRépondent les Français : « Mal vous le demanderez.
output: Respundent Francs : « Mar le demandereiz.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTout soit félon qui n'y frappe à l'exploit ! »
output: Trestut seit fel ki n'i fierget a espleit ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe jour passe, il tourne à la soirée.
output: Passet li jurz, si turnet a la vespree.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nFrançais et païens y frappent des épées.
output: Franc e paien i fierent des espees.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCeux-ci sont vassaux qui ajustent les armées.
output: Cil sunt vassal ki les oz ajusterent.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLeurs enseignes n'y ont pas été oubliées :
output: Lor enseignes n'i unt mie ubliees :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'amiral a crié « Preciuse ! »,
output: Li amiralz « Preciuse ! » ad criee,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCharles « Montjoie ! » l'enseigne renommée.
output: Carles « Munjoie ! » l'enseigne renumee.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'un reconnaît l'autre aux voix hautes et claires.
output: L'un conuist l'altre as haltes voiz e as cleres.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAu milieu du champ, tous deux se rencontrent,
output: En mi le camp amdui s'entr'encuntrerent,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls vont se frapper, de grands coups s'échangent
output: Si se vunt ferir, granz colps s'entredunerent

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe leurs lances sur leurs écus ronds.
output: De lor espiez en lor targes roees.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls les ont brisés sous ces boucles larges ;
output: Fraites les unt desuz cez bucles lees ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe leurs cottes de mailles, ils ont séparé les pans :
output: De lor osbercs les pans en desevrerent :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDans ces corps, ils ne se sont pas blessés.
output: Dedenz cez cors mie ne s'adeserent.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTrès vaillamment, ils ont tiré les épées.
output: Mult vassalment unt traites les espees.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCette bataille ne sera jamais détournée :
output: Cette bataille n'en ert mais destornee :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nHomme saint mort ne peut être achevée.
output: Seinz hume mort ne poet estre achevee.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTrès vaillant est Charles de douce France ;
output: Mult est vassal carles de france dulce ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'amiral, il ne le craint ni ne le redoute.
output: Li amiralz, il nel crent ne ne dutet.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls montrent toutes leurs épées nues,
output: Cez lor espees tutes nues i mustrent,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSur ces écus, de grands coups s'échangent,
output: Sur cez escuz mult granz colps s'entredunent,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls tranchent les cottes et ces fourrures qui sont doublées ;
output: Trenchent les quirs e cez fuz ki sunt dubles ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes clous tombent, ils percent les boucles ;
output: Cheent li clou, si peceient les bucles ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPuis ils frappent nu à nu sur leurs cottes de mailles ;
output: Puis fierent il nud a nud sur lur bronies ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDes casques clairs, le feu en jaillit.
output: Des helmes clers li fuus en escarbunet.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCette bataille ne peut jamais rester,
output: Ceste bataille ne poet remaneir unkes,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJusqu'à ce que l'un reconnaisse son tort.
output: Josque li uns sun tort i reconuisset.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDit l'amiral : « Charles, pense à toi,
output: Dist l'amiraill : « carles, kar te purpenses,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt prends conseil de te repentir envers moi !
output: Si pren cunseill que vers mei te repentes !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTu as tué mon fils, par ma connaissance ;
output: Mort as mun filz, par le men esciente ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ très grand tort, tu me contestes mon pays.
output: A mult grant tort mun païs me calenges.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDeviens mon homme [en fidélité, je veux rendre]
output: Deven mes hom [en fedeltet voeill rendre]

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nViens me servir d'ici jusqu'en Orient. »
output: Ven mei servir d'ici qu'en Oriente. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCharles répond : « Très grande vilenie me semble.
output: Carles respunt : « Mult grant viltet me semble.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPaix ni amour, je ne dois à païen rendre.
output: Pais ne amor ne dei a paien rendre.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nReçois la loi que Dieu nous a présentée,
output: Receif la lei que Deus nos apresentet,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLa chrétienté, et puis je t'aimerai toujours ;
output: Chrestientet, e pui t'amerai sempres ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPuis sers et crois le roi tout-puissant. »
output: Puis serf e crei le rei omnipotente. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDit Baligant : « Mauvais sermon commences ! »
output: Dist Baligant : « Malvais sermun cumences ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPuis ils vont frapper des épées qu'ils ont ceintes.
output: Puis vunt ferir des espees qu'unt ceintes.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'amiral est de très grande vertu.
output: Li amiralz est mult de grant vertut.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl frappe Charles sur le casque d'acier brun,
output: Fier Carlemagne sur l'elme d'acer brun,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSur la tête, il lui a brisé et fendu ;
output: Desur la teste li ad frait e fendut ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl met l'épée sur ses cheveux menus,
output: Met li l'espee sur les chevels menuz,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl prend de la chair une pleine paume et plus :
output: Prent de la carn grant pleine palme e plus :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLà, reste l'os tout nu.
output: Iloec endreit remeint li os tut nut.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCharles chancelle, pour peu qu'il ne tombe ;
output: Carles cancelet, por poi qu'il n'est caüt ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMais Dieu ne veut qu'il soit mort ni vaincu.
output: Mais Deus ne volt qu'il seit mort ne vencut.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSaint Gabriel est revenu à lui,
output: Seint Gabriel est repairet a lui,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl lui demande : « Roi grand, que fais-tu ? »
output: Si li demandet : « Reis magnes, que fais tu ? »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQuand Charles entend la sainte voix de l'ange,
output: Quant carles oït la seinte voiz de l'angle,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl n'a pas peur ni crainte de mourir ;
output: Nen ad poür ne de murir dutance ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl retrouve vigueur et mémoire.
output: Repairet loi vigur e remembrance.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl frappe l'amiral de l'épée de France,
output: Fiert l'amiraill de l'espee de France,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl brise le casque aux gemmes flamboyantes,
output: L'elme li freint o li gemme reflambent,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl tranche la tête pour répandre le cerveau
output: Trenchet la teste pur la cervele espandre

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt tout le visage jusqu'à la barbe blanche,
output: E tut le vis tresqu'en la barbe blanche,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQu'il le renverse mort sans nulle recouvrance.
output: Que mort l'abat senz nule recouvrance.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Montjoie ! » crie-t-il pour la reconnaissance.
output: « Munjoie ! » escriet pur la reconuisance.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ ce mot, le duc Naimes est venu :
output: A icest mot venuz i est dux Neimes :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl prend Tencendur, le roi grand y monte.
output: Prent Tencendur, muntet i est li reis magnes.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes païens se retournent, Dieu ne voit qu'ils y restent.
output: Paien s'en turnent, ne voit Deus qu'il i remainent.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMaintenant, les Français sont à ceux qu'ils demandent.
output: Or sunt Franceis a icels qu'il demandent.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes païens s'enfuient, comme Dieu le veut.
output: Paien s'en fuient, cum damnesdeus le volt.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes Français les poursuivent et l'empereur avec.
output: Encalcent Franc e l'emperere avoec.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDit le roi : « Seigneurs, vengez vos douleurs,
output: Ço dist li reis : « Seignurs, vengez voz doels,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt éclairez vos talents et vos cœurs,
output: Si esclargiez voz talenz e voz coers,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCar ce matin, je vous ai vus pleurer des yeux. »
output: Kar hoi matin vos vi plurer des oilz. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nRépondent les Français : « Seigneur, cela nous est nécessaire. »
output: Respondent Franc : « Sire, ço nus estoet. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nChacun y frappe de grands coups comme il peut.
output: Cascuns i fiert tanz granz colps cum il poet.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPeu s'en échappent de ceux qui sont là.
output: Poi s'en estoerstrent d'icels ki sunt iloec.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nGrande est la chaleur, la poussière se lève.
output: Granz est li calz, si se levet la puldre.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes païens s'enfuient et les Français les angoissent ;
output: Paien s'en fuient e Franceis les anguissent ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLa poursuite dure d'ici jusqu'à Saragosse.
output: Li enchalz duret d'ici qu'en Sarraguce.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEn haut de sa tour, est montée Bramidonie,
output: En sum sa tur muntee est Bramidonie,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAvec elle, ses clercs et ses chanoines
output: Ensembl'od li si clerc e si canonie

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe fausse loi que Dieu n'a jamais aimée :
output: De false lei que Deus nen amat unkes :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls n'ont pas d'ordres ni de couronnes sur leurs têtes.
output: Ordres nen unt ne en lor chefs corones.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'âme de lui, aux diables vivants, elle donne.
output: L'anme de lui as vifs diables dunet.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe Saragosse, elle a abattu la porte :
output: De Sarraguce ad la porte abatue :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMaintenant, elle sait bien qu'elle n'est plus défendue.
output: Or set il ben que n'est mais defendue.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nElle prend la cité, son peuple y est venu :
output: Prent la citet, sa gent i est venue :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPar puissance, cette nuit, ils y jurent.
output: Par poestet icele noit i jurent.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nFier est le roi à la barbe blanche.
output: Fiers est li reis a la barbe canue.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt Bramidonie lui a rendu les tours :
output: E Bramidonie les turs li ad rendues :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes dix sont grandes, les cinquante petites.
output: Les dis sunt grandes, les cinquante menues.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTrès bien réussit celui que Dieu aide.
output: Mult ben espleitet qui Damnesdeus aiuet.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe jour passe, la nuit est arrivée ;
output: Passet li jurz, la noit est aserie ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLa lune est claire et les étoiles flamboyantes.
output: Clere est la lune e les esteiles flambient.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'empereur a pris Saragosse.
output: Li emperere ad Sarraguce prise.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ mille Français, ils font bien chercher la ville,
output: A mil Franceis funt ben cercer la vile,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes synagogues et les mahoméries ;
output: Les sinagoges e les mahumeries ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAvec des maillets de fer et des haches qu'ils tiennent,
output: A mailz de fer e a cuignees qu'il tindrent,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls brisent les images et toutes les idoles :
output: Fruissent les ymagenes e trestutes les ydeles :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl n'y restera ni sort ni tromperie.
output: N'i remeindrat ne sorz ne falserie.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe roi croit en Dieu, il veut faire son service,
output: Li reis creit en Deu, faire voelt sun servise,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt ses évêques bénissent les églises,
output: E si evesque les eves beneïssent,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls mènent les païens jusqu'au baptistère :
output: Meinent paien entesqu'al baptisterie :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSi maintenant, il y a celui qui contredit Charles,
output: S'or i ad cel qui Carle cuntredie,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl le fait pendre ou brûler ou tuer.
output: Il le fait pendre o ardeir ou ocire.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls sont baptisés, plus de cent mille
output: Baptizet sunt asez plus de .C. milie

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nVrais chrétiens, sauf seulement la reine.
output: Veir chrestien, ne mais sul la reïne.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEn douce France, elle sera menée captive :
output: En France dulce iert menee caitive :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCela veut le roi par amour qu'elle se convertisse.
output: Ço voelt li reis par amur cunvertisset.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLa nuit passe, le jour clair apparaît.
output: Passet la noit, si apert le cler jor.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe Saragosse, Charles garnit les tours ;
output: De Sarraguce Carles guarnist les turs ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMille chevaliers, il laisse comme gouverneurs ;
output: Mil chevalers i laissat puigneürs ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls gardent la ville pour l'empereur.
output: Guardent la vile a oes l'empereor.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe roi monte et tous ses hommes
output: Muntet li reis e si hume trestuz

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt Bramidonie, qu'il mène en sa prison ;
output: E Bradimonie, qu'il meinet en sa prisun ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMais il n'a pas l'intention de lui faire que du bien.
output: Mais n'ad talent que li facet se bien nun.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls sont revenus avec joie et vaillance.
output: Repairez sunt a joie e a baldur.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls passent la Gironde avec de grands navires qui y sont ;
output: Passet Girunde a mult granz nefs qu'i sunt ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJusqu'à Blaye, il a conduit son neveu
output: Entresqu'a Blaive ad cunduit sun nevold

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt Olivier, son noble compagnon,
output: E Oliver, sun nobilie cumpaignun,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt l'archevêque, qui fut sage et preux.
output: E l'arcevesque, ki fut sages e proz.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDans des cercueils blancs, il fait mettre les seigneurs,
output: En blancs sarcous fait metre les seignurs,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ Saint-Romain : là gisent les barons.
output: A Seint Romain : la gisent li baron.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes Français les recommandent à Dieu et à ses saints.
output: Francs les cumandent a Deu e a ses nuns.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCharles chevauche et les vallées et les montagnes ;
output: Carles cevalchet e les vals e les munz ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJusqu'à Aix, il ne veut prendre séjour.
output: Entresqu'a Ais ne volt prendre sujurn.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl chevauche tant qu'il descend au perron.
output: Tant chevalchat qu'il descent al perrun.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nComme il est dans son palais haut,
output: Cume il est en sun paleis halçur,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPar ses messagers, il mande ses juges,
output: Par ses messages mandet ses jugeors,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nBavarois et Saxons, Lorrains et Frisons ;
output: Baivers e Saisnes, Loherencs e Frisuns ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl mande les Allemands, il mande les Bourguignons
output: Alemans mandet, si mandet Borguignuns

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt les Poitevins et les Normands et les Bretons,
output: E Peitevins e Normans e Bretuns,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe ceux de France, des plus sages qui sont.
output: De cels de France des plus saives qui sunt.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDès lors, commence le procès de Ganelon.
output: Des ore cumencet le plait de Guenelun.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'empereur est revenu d'Espagne
output: Li empereres est repairet d'espaigne

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt vient à Aix, au meilleur siège de France ;
output: E vient a Ais, a meillor sied de France ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl monte au palais, il est venu dans la salle.
output: Muntet el palais, est venut en la sale.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ lui est venue Alde, une belle demoiselle.
output: As li Alde venue, une bele damisele.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nElle dit au roi : « Où est Roland le capitaine,
output: Ço dist al rei : « O est Rollant le catanie,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQui me jura comme sa parente à prendre ? »
output: Ki me jurat cume sa per a prendre ? »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCharles en a douleur et peine,
output: Carles en ad e dulor e pesance,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl pleure des yeux, il tire sa barbe blanche :
output: Pluret des oilz, tiret sa barbe blance :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSœur, chère amie, d'un homme mort, tu demandes.
output: Soer, cher'amie, d'hume mort me demandes.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJe te donnerai un échange très fort :
output: Jo t'en durai mult esforcet eschange :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nC'est Louis, mieux je ne sais parler ;
output: Ço est Loewis, mielz ne sai a parler ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl est mon fils et il tiendra mes marches. »
output: Il est mes filz e si tendrat mes marches. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAlde répond : « C'est mot pour moi étrange.
output: Alde respunt : « C'est mot mei est estrange.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQue Dieu ne plaise ni ses saints ni ses anges
output: Ne place Deu ne ses seinz ne ses angles

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQu'après Roland, je vive et reste ! »
output: Après Rollant que jo vive remaigne ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nElle perd la couleur, tombe aux pieds de Charlemagne,
output: Pert la culor, chet as piez Carlemagne,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nElle est morte. Que Dieu ait pitié de son âme !
output: Sempres est morte. Deus ait mercit de l'anme !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes barons français pleurent et la lamentent.
output: Franceis barons en plurent e si la pleignent.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAlde la belle est à sa fin allée.
output: Alde la bel'est a sa fin alee.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe roi pensait qu'elle s'était évanouie ;
output: Quidet li reis que el se seit pasmee ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl en a pitié, l'empereur pleure ;
output: Pited en ad, sin pluret l'emperere ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl la prend par les mains, il l'a relevée.
output: Prent la as mains, si l'en ad relevee.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSur ses épaules, elle a la tête inclinée.
output: Desur les espalles ad la teste clinee.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQuand Charles voit qu'elle est morte,
output: Quant Carles veit que morte l'ad truvee,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQuatre comtesses, il a mandées :
output: Quatre cuntesses sempres i ad mandees :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ un monastère de nonnes, elle est portée ;
output: A un muster de nuneins est portee ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLa nuit, elles la veillent jusqu'à l'aube.
output: La noit la guaitent entresqu'a l'ajurnee.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe long d'un autel, elles l'enterrent doucement.
output: Lunc un alter belement l'enterrerent.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe roi lui a donné un très grand honneur.
output: Mult grant honur i ad li reis dunee.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'empereur est revenu à Aix.
output: Li emperere est repairet ad ais.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nGanelon le félon, en chaînes de fer,
output: Guenes li fels, en caeines de fer,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDans la cité, est devant le palais ;
output: En la citet est devant le paleis ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ un poteau, les serfs l'ont attaché.
output: A un'estache l'unt atachet cil serf.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes mains, ils lui lient avec des courroies de cerf ;
output: Les mains li lient a curreies de cerf ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTrès bien, ils le battent avec des fouets et des courroies :
output: Tres ben le batent a fuz e a jamelz :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl n'a mérité que d'autre bien y ait ;
output: N'ad deservit que altre ben i ait ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ grande douleur, il attend là son procès.
output: A grant dulur iloec atent sun plait.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl est écrit dans l'ancienne geste
output: Il est escrit en l'ancienne geste

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQue Charles a mandé des hommes de plusieurs terres.
output: Que Carles mandet humes de plusurs teres.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls sont assemblés à Aix, à la chapelle.
output: Asemblez sunt ad Ais, a la capele.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe jour est haut, la fête est très grande,
output: Halz est li jurz, mult par est grande la feste,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCertains disent du baron saint Silvestre.
output: Dient alquanz del baron seint Silvestre.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDès lors, commence le procès et les nouvelles
output: Dès ore cumencet le plait et les noveles

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe Ganelon, qui a fait trahison.
output: De Guenelun, ki traïsun ad faite.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'empereur devant lui l'a fait traîner.
output: Li emperere devant sei l'ad fait traire.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Seigneurs barons, » dit Charles le roi,
output: « seignors barons, » dist carlemagnes li reis,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« De Ganelon, jugez-moi le droit !
output: « De Guenelun car me jugez le dreit !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl fut dans l'armée jusqu'en Espagne avec moi,
output: Il fut en l'ost tresqu'en Espaigne od mei,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl m'a enlevé vingt mille de mes Français
output: Si me tolit .XX. milie de mes Franceis

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt mon neveu, que jamais plus vous ne verrez,
output: E mun nevold, que ja mais ne verreiz,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt Olivier, le preux et le courtois ;
output: E Oliver, li proz e li curteis ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes douze pairs, il a trahi pour de l'argent. »
output: Les .XII. pers ad traït por aveir. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDit Ganelon : « Que je sois félon si je le fais !
output: Dist Guenelon : « Fel seie se jol ceil !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nRoland m'a offensé en or et en argent,
output: Rollant me forfist en or e en aveir,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPour cela, j'ai voulu sa mort et sa détresse ;
output: Pur que jo quis sa mort e sun destreit ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nMais trahison, je n'en ai pas accordée. »
output: Mais traïsun nule n'en i otrei. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nRépondent les Français : « Nous en tiendrons conseil. »
output: Respundent Franc : « Ore en tendrum cunseill. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDevant le roi, Ganelon se tient.
output: Devant le rei la s'estut guenelun.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl a le corps vigoureux, le visage de belle couleur ;
output: Cors ad gaillard, el vis gente color ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nS'il était loyal, il ressemblerait bien à un baron.
output: S'il fust leials, ben resemblast barun.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl voit ceux de France et tous les juges,
output: Veit cels de France e tuz les jugeürs,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe ses parents, trente qui sont avec lui ;
output: De ses parenz .XXX. ki od lui sunt ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPuis il s'écrie hautement, à grande voix :
output: Puis s'escriat haltement, a grant voeiz :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Par amour de Dieu, écoutez-moi, barons !
output: « Pur amor Deu, car m'entendez, barons !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSeigneurs, j'étais dans l'armée avec l'empereur,
output: Seignors, jo fui en l'ost avoec l'empereür,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJe le servais par foi et par amour.
output: Serveie le par feid e par amur.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nRoland, son neveu, m'a pris en haine,
output: Rollant sis niés me coillit en haür,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl m'a jugé à mort et à douleur.
output: Si me jugat a mort e a dulur.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJ'étais messager au roi Marsile ;
output: Message fui al rei Marsiliun ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPar ma sagesse, je suis revenu en sécurité.
output: Par mun saveir vinc jo a guarisun.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJ'ai défié Roland le batailleur
output: Jo desfiai Rollant le poigneor

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt Olivier et tous leurs compagnons :
output: E Oliver e tuiz lur cumpaignun :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCharles l'a entendu et ses nobles barons.
output: Carles l'oïd e si nobilie baron.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nJe m'en suis vengé, mais il n'y a pas de trahison. »
output: Venget m'en sui, mais n'i ad traïsun. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nRépondent les Français : « Nous en irons en conseil. »
output: Respundent Francs : « A conseill en irums. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQuand Ganelon voit que ses grands procès commencent,
output: Quant guenes veit que ses granz plaiz cumencet,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe ses parents, ensemble, il y en a trente.
output: De ses parenz ensemble en i out trente.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl n'y a pas de Français qui vous juge à pendre,
output: N'i ad Francès ki vos juget a pendre,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nOu l'empereur nous assemble les deux corps,
output: U l'emperere les noz dous cors en asemble,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAu tranchant d'acier, je ne le désavouerai pas. »
output: Al brant d'acer que jo ne l'en desmente. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nGanelon le comte se présente à ses pieds.
output: Guenes li quens a ses piez se presente.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nBavarois et Saxons sont allés en conseil
output: Bavier e saisnes sunt alet a conseill

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt Poitevins et Normands et Français ;
output: E Peitevin e Norman e Franceis ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl y a assez d'Allemands et de Thuringiens ;
output: Asez i ad Alemans e Tiedeis ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCeux d'Auvergne sont les plus courtois.
output: Icels d'Alverne i sunt li plus curteis.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPour Pinabel, ils se contiennent plus que nécessaire.

output: Laisum le plait e si preium le rei

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPuis qu'il vous serve par foi et par amour.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl enbrunit beaucoup son visage et son visage,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCourtoisement, il a dit à l'empereur :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl fait garder ceux-ci jusqu'à ce que le droit soit rendu.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDe grandes offrandes, ils mettent par ces monastères.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLeurs éperons, ils ont chaussés à leurs pieds,

output: Cil sunt produme e de grant vasselage

output: De cez espees enheldees d'or mer

output: De Guenelun justise ert faite tel

output: Asez est dreiz que Guenes seit pendut

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nVenu est l'empereur Charles,
output: Venuz i est li emperere Carles,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEnsemble avec lui, de ses barons, il y a quatre,
output: Ensembl'od lui de ses baruns ad quatre,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nNaimes le duc, Ogier de Danemark,
output: Naimes li dux, Oger de Danemarche,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nGeoffroi d'Anjou et Guillaume de Blaye.
output: Geifrei d'Anjou e Willalme de Blaive.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe roi a pris Tierri entre ses bras,
output: Li reis ad pris Tierri entre sa brace,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl lui essuie le visage avec ses grands poils de martre,
output: Tert lui le vis od ses granz pels de martre,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl met celles-ci à terre, puis lui en affuble d'autres ;
output: Celes met jus, puis li afublent altres ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTrès doucement, ils désarment le chevalier.
output: Mult suavet le chevaler desarment.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls l'ont fait monter sur une mule d'Arabie ;
output: Munter l'unt fait en une mule d'Arabe ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl revient avec joie et noblesse ;
output: Repairet s'en a joie e a barnage ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls viennent à Aix, ils descendent sur la place.
output: Vienent ad Ais, descendent en la place.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nDès lors, commence l'exécution des autres.
output: Dès ore cumencet l'ocisiun des altres.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCharles appelle ses comtes et ses ducs :
output: Carles apelet ses cuntes e ses dux :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Que me conseillez-vous de ceux que j'ai retenus ?
output: « Que me loez de cels qu'ai retenuz ?

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPour Ganelon, ils étaient venus en procès,
output: Pur Guenelun erent a plait venuz,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPour Pinabel, en otage rendus. »
output: Pur Pinabel en ostage renduz. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nRépondent les Français : « Jamais aucun ne vivra ! »
output: Respundent Franc : « Ja mar en vivrat uns ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe roi commande à un de ses vassaux, Basbrun :
output: Li reis cumandet un soen veier, Basbrun :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Va, pends-les tous à l'arbre de mauvais bois !
output: « Va, sis pent tuz a l'arbre de mal fust !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPar cette barbe dont les poils sont blancs,
output: Par ceste barbe dunt li peil sunt canuz,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSi un échappe, tu es mort et confondu. »
output: Se uns escapet, morz iez e cunfunduz. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCelui-ci répond : « Que ferais-je d'autre ? »
output: Cil li respunt : « Qu'en fereie jo el ? »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nAvec cent sergents, par force, il les conduit.
output: Od .C. serjanz par force les cunduit.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTrente, il y en a de ceux qui sont pendus.
output: .XXX. en i ad d'icels ki sunt pendut.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCelui qui trahit, il se tue et autrui.
output: Ki hume traïst sei ocit e altroi.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPuis sont retournés Bavarois et Allemands
output: Puis sunt turnet bavier e aleman

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt Poitevins et Bretons et Normands.
output: E Peitevin e Bretun e Norman.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSur tous les autres, les Français l'ont accordé
output: Sor tuit li altre l'unt otriet li Franc

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQue Ganelon mourrait par merveilleux supplice.
output: Que Guenes moerget par merveillus ahan.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQuatre destriers font amener devant,
output: Quatre destrers funt amener avant,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPuis ils lui lient et les pieds et les mains.
output: Puis si li lient e les piez e les mains.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes chevaux sont orgueilleux et rapides :
output: Li cheval sunt orgoillus e curant :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQuatre sergents les accueillent devant
output: Quatre serjanz les acoeillent devant

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nVers une eau qui est au milieu d'un champ.
output: Devers un'ewe ki est en mi un camp.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nGanelon est retourné à grande perdition ;
output: Guenes est turnet a perdiciun grant ;

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTous ses nerfs lui sont très tendus
output: Trestuit si nerf mult li sunt estendant

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt tous les membres de son corps déchirés :
output: E tuit li membre de sun cors derumpant :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSur l'herbe verte, le sang clair s'étend.
output: Sur l'erbe verte en espant li cler sanc.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nGanelon est mort comme félon lâche.
output: Guenes est mort cume fel recreant.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nHomme qui trahit, il n'est pas juste qu'il s'en vante.
output: Hom ki traïst altre nen est dreiz qu'il s'en vant.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQuand l'empereur a fait sa vengeance,
output: Quant li empereres ad faite sa venjance,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl appelle ses évêques de France,
output: Sin apelat ses evesques de France,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nCeux de Bavière et ceux d'Allemagne :
output: Cels de Baviere e icels d'Alemaigne :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Dans ma maison, il y a une captive franche.
output: « En ma maisun ad une caitive franche.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nTant elle a entendu et sermons et exemples
output: Tant ad oït e sermuns e essamples

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nElle veut croire en Dieu, elle demande la chrétienté.
output: Creire voelt Deu, chrestientet demandet.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls baptisent la reine d'Espagne :
output: La baptizent la reïne d'Espaigne :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIls lui ont trouvé le nom de Juliane.
output: Truvé li unt le num de Juliane.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nElle est chrétienne par vraie connaissance.
output: Chrestiene est par veire conoisance.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nQuand l'empereur a fait sa justice
output: Quant l'emperere ad faite sa justise

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEt sa grande colère est éclaircie.
output: E esclargiez est la sue grant ire.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nEn Bramidonie, il a mis la chrétienté,
output: En Bramidonie ad chrestientet mise,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe jour passe, la nuit est arrivée.
output: Passet li jurz, la nuit est aserie.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe roi s'est couché dans sa chambre voûtée.
output: Culcez s'est li reis en sa cambre voltice.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nSaint Gabriel de la part de Dieu lui vint dire :
output: Seint Gabriel de part Deu li vint dire :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Charles, convoque les armées de ton empire !
output: « Carles, sumun les oz de tun emperie !

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nPar force, tu iras en la terre de Bire,
output: Par force iras en la tere de Bire,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLe roi Vivien, tu secourras à Imphe,
output: Reis Vivien si succuras en Imphe,

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nÀ la cité que les païens ont assiégée :
output: A la citet que paien unt asise :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nLes chrétiens te réclament et crient. »
output: Li chrestien te recleiment e crient. »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nL'empereur ne veut pas y aller :
output: Li emperere n'i volsist aler mie :

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\n« Dieu, » dit le roi, « si pénible est ma vie ! »
output: « Deus, » dist li reis, « si penuse est ma vie ! »

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIl pleure des yeux, il tire sa barbe blanche.
output: Pluret des oilz, sa barbe blanche tiret.

instruction: Translate the following text from French to Old French. Reply with the translation only, without explanations or additional text:\nIci finit la geste que Turold déclina.
output: Ci falt la geste que Turoldus declinet.
